3:55.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
3:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.9) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.25 & 2.55 +10yds)

runners.name: Amorim
runners.comment: 250,000gns foal, 500,000gns yearling; Havana Grey half-brother to smart sprinter Rumstar
runners.spotlight: 250,000gns foal, 500,000gns yearling; Havana Grey half-brother to 5f/6f winner Rumstar (including 2yo/Group 3; RPR 116); dam 5f/6f scorer (including 2yo; 100), out of 6f 2yo Group 2 winner; likely type.

runners.name: Front Line Fury
runners.comment: 45,000euros foal, £90,000 yearling; connections won this race with a newcomer in 2023
runners.spotlight: 45,000euros foal, £90,000 yearling; Kodi Bear half-brother to winners Maw Lam (Group-placed 5f 2yo; RPR 97) and Smullen's Pride (5f; 75); connections won this race with a newcomer (SP 14-1) in 2023.

runners.name: Guest House
runners.comment: 85,000gns yearling; by Dark Angel; yard is 0-49 with 2yos in last five seasons
runners.spotlight: 85,000gns yearling; Dark Angel half-brother to 7f 2yo/1m winner Thunder Wonder (RPR 96), out of 7f 2yo/French 12.5f turf Group 2 scorer (106); yard is 0-49 with 2yos in last five seasons; best watched.

runners.name: Kuu
runners.comment: 22,000gns foal, 58,000gns yearling, 180,000gns (breeze-up) 2yo; seems to have potential
runners.spotlight: 22,000gns foal, 58,000gns yearling, 180,000gns (breeze-up) 2yo; Kameko half-brother to winners Flippin' Eck (6f 2yo; RPR 74) and Alfie Boy (7f-8.4f; 71); has potential judged on those sales increases.

runners.name: Loblolly
runners.comment: 70,000euros yearling; pedigree suggests he's likely to need further than this trip
runners.spotlight: 23,000gns foal, 70,000euros yearling; Invincible Spirit half-brother to 1m AW 2yo/1m2f turf winner Brindavan (RPR 91), out of well-related 9.7f/11.3f scorer (61); may find this 6f trip too sharp.

runners.name: Peel Park
runners.comment: 350,000gns yearling; by Mehmas and has 2yo winners on dam's side; Ryan Moore booked
runners.spotlight: 350,000gns yearling; by Mehmas and first foal of 1m3f AW winner (RPR 89) who is half-sister to 6f 2yo Listed winner Straight Answer and daughter of Group-placed 7f 2yo scorer; Ryan Moore booked; interesting.

runners.name: Postmodern
runners.comment: 270,000gns yearling; by Too Darn Hot; stable's first 2yo runner of the season
runners.spotlight: 270,000gns yearling; Too Darn Hot half-brother to two winners, notably Be Your Best (US 8.5f-1m3f turf including 2yo/Grade 2; RPR 115); stable's first 2yo runner of the seasons; heed the market signals.

runners.name: Silent Applause
runners.comment: 70,000euros yearling, 1,400,000gns (breeze-up) 2yo; powerful yard; commands respect
runners.spotlight: 70,000euros yearling, 1,400,000gns (breeze-up) 2yo; brother to 7f AW winner Viridian (RPR 64), half-brother to 5f winner Carry On Aitch (60); dam maiden (60), half-sister to 1m Group 3 winner Oh Goodness Me and 1m4f Listed Flat/smart jumps winner Eradicate; represents last year's winning yard; respected.

runners.name: Wild Thoughts
runners.comment: The only runner who has experience but trailed home last of 13 at Ascot
runners.spotlight: The only runner who has the benefit of experience but achieved little at Ascot (5f) where he trailed home last of 13; seems unlikely trouble some interesting types among the newcomers.

3:25.race_name: British Stallion Studs EBF Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
3:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.9) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.25 & 2.55 +10yds)

runners.name: Acceptance
runners.breeder: Ecurie Haras Du Cadran, Ecurie Melaine
runners.comment: Showed speed before dropping away at Southwell on last month's debut; can do better
runners.spotlight: 105,000euros yearling; showed speed before dropping away in the final furlong on last month's Southwell debut (5f, Tapeta); should last longer with the run behind her.

runners.name: Bosh Soldier
runners.comment: 23,000gns yearling; dam a modest maiden; the betting should be revealing
runners.spotlight: March foal; 23,000gns yearling; second foal of a maiden half-sister to useful sprint winner Show Stealer; trainer can get them ready first time and the betting should provide clues.

runners.name: Duskaura
runners.comment: £62,000 Breeze-Up 2yo; lots to like on paper and yard's 2yos off the mark on Wednesday
runners.spotlight: March foal; 18,000euros yearling, £62,000 Breeze-Up 2yo; half-sister to three winners out of a useful and well-related 7f winner (RPR 101); stable does have winning newcomers and got off the mark with their 2yos on Wednesday; the betting should provide clues.

runners.name: Kuiama
runners.comment: Well beaten in two runs last month; new cheekpieces not enough to tempt
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two runs last month; new cheekpieces not enough to tempt.

runners.name: Oliaku
runners.comment: Sales price rocketed to 275,000gns at last month's Breeze Up sale; yard having a fine year
runners.spotlight: February foal; 57,000gns yearling and sales price rocketed to 275,000gns at last month's Craven Breeze-Up; first foal of an unraced half-sister to some useful winners; stable having a fine year, including a couple of 2yo winners, and she's a newcomer of some interest.

runners.name: Staya
runners.comment: Bred to be sharp and fetched 375,000gns at a recent Breeze-Up sale; considered
runners.spotlight: April foal; 90,000gns foal, 51,000gns yearling, 375,000gns Breeze-Up 2yo; third foal; half-sister to winners Miss Show Off (5f/6f including 2yo; RPR 89) and Miss Show Down (5f 2yo; 73); dam Italian 5f-1m winner (including 2yo/Listed; 96); recent purchase price is eyecatching but stable 0-7 (just one placed) with this year's 2yos (as of Tuesday).

runners.name: Yellow Diamonds
runners.comment: 170,000gns Breeze-Up purchase; dam 5f 2yo Listed winner; lots to like on paper
runners.spotlight: February foal; 62,000euros yearling, 170,000gns Breeze-Up 2yo; second foal of 5f 2yo winner (including Listed; RPR 99); stable 2-9 with 2yos this year (one successful on debut); looks a likely type.

2:55.race_name: Winning Experience With Moulton Racing Handicap
2:55.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.9) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.25 & 2.55 +10yds)

runners.name: Risen Again
runners.comment: Made all for easy win over C&D last week; due to be 2lb higher in future; leading player
runners.spotlight: Made all for easy success in similar event over C&D (good to firm) last week, opening his account at the 14th attempt; leading player under penalty, provided that form is backed up; future mark 2lb higher.

runners.name: Pursuit Of Truth
runners.comment: Seven-race maiden; unexposed over middle distances; may well build on latest effort
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden; ran well upped to 1m4f (from 8.5f) in AW contest at Kempton most recently (second start for new stable); may well build on that effort, being unexposed over middle distances.

runners.name: Con Te Partiro
runners.comment: Five AW wins at up to 1m2f; seemingly a non-stayer over 1m4f/1m6f since switched to turf
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW scorer at up to 1m2f; seemingly a non-stayer over 1m4f/1m6f since switched to turf; this drop back in trip is a plus and he's competitively treated off 1lb below last winning mark.

quotes.race: Get Raceday Ready Handicap
quotes.quote: Con Te Partiro has been a bit of a big baby and a slow burner but he's learning with racing. We had the run of the race stepping up in trip today, we went quite slow in the back but sprinted up the straight. I was a bit worried as he can be a bit idle but he stuck to the task well. He's a good moving horse, very straightforward, and I don't see why he can't translate what he's shown to the turf - Hollie Doyle, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Blenheim Star
runners.comment: All wins over 1m, including latest start; likely player provided she stays this new trip
runners.spotlight: Churchill filly who has registered all four wins over 1m, mostly at Brighton, including latest start (good to firm); looks one of the likelier players in this field, provided she stays the new trip.

quotes.race: Weatherbys ePassport Handicap
quotes.quote: Cieren [Fallon, jockey] gave Blenheim Star a sensible ride and she won with a fair bit in hand again. It's nice when they handle a track like Brighton as you're always happy to go back. Hopefully there's more improvement in her, I think she'd benefit for a step up to a mile and a quarter - William Knight, trainer.

runners.name: Aim For The Moon
runners.comment: Recorded sole win over C&D but she's a habitual slow-starter and comes with risk
runners.spotlight: Record is only 1-16; gained the success over C&D but she's a habitual slow-stater, sometimes markedly so, including latest run (hampered at one point and always behind); capable but comes with risk.

runners.name: Queens Company
runners.comment: Good claims if back on song, being a three-time Yarmouth scorer who is on a handy mark
runners.spotlight: Ended last season in good form but hasn't transferred it to this season; certainly has good claims if back on song, being a three-time Yarmouth scorer who is on a workable mark.

runners.name: Mr Nugget
runners.comment: Has regressed since his AW win; failed to beat a rival in both turf attempts
runners.spotlight: Opened his account in 1m3f AW contest in February but has regressed in two subsequent outings; failed to beat a rival in both turf attempts; enough to prove back in this sphere.

runners.name: Prefer The Sister
runners.comment: The way she shaped over 1m here last week suggests this new trip is worth exploring
runners.spotlight: Recorded sole win over 7f on AW; however, the way she shaped over 1m here last week suggests this new trip is worth exploring; receives weight all round and could go well.

4:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.9) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.25 & 2.55 +10yds)

runners.name: Capital Guarantee
runners.comment: Scored comfortably at Thirsk last Saturday; due to go up 5lb in future; respected
runners.spotlight: Scored comfortably at Thirsk (1m, good to firm) last Saturday, taking record since having wind surgery to 2-3; due to go up 5lb in future and Cian Horgan's claim, which offsets a penalty, is a bonus; effective at 7f; respected.

runners.name: Giorgio M
runners.comment: Returns to a much more suitable scenario off last winning mark; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f scorer; posted consistent efforts on AW in January/February; never figured over 1m2f in higher grade last time; returns to a much more suitable scenario off last winning mark and looks one to consider.

runners.name: Giant
runners.comment: Fighting chance provided he transfers AW ability back to turf and takes to new headgear
runners.spotlight: Raced mainly on AW, winning twice over 7f; close fourth at Kempton returned to this trip last time; fighting chance off same mark, provided he's as effective back on turf and takes well to new headgear.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap
quotes.quote: I think the gelding (operation) has helped and a bit of a break and Giant has come back fresh and well. Everything went to plan and he's done it nicely - Richard Spencer, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Lessay
runners.comment: Dual AW scorer; turf record suggests he may need slow ground in this sphere
runners.spotlight: Similar type to Giant, having gained both wins on AW, and ties in with that rival on Kempton running last time; however, turf record suggests he may need ground softer than good in this sphere.

runners.name: Chola Empire
runners.comment: One of several runners who have never won on turf; regressive since last AW win
runners.spotlight: One of several runners who have never won on turf; regressive results since most recent AW success (in February) and was unplaced over C&D when last seen in this sphere; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Shaw Park
runners.breeder: D Farrington, P Gately, T Killarney
runners.comment: Incurs 5lb penalty for narrow C&D win but Taryn Langley takes off 7lb; enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Record of 221 since returned to turf, most recently holding on narrowly over C&D (good to firm) last week; incurs 5lb penalty but Taryn Langley takes off 7lb; this in-form contender is one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Mister Mojito
runners.comment: Two AW wins this spring; gained sole turf success over C&D but is 15lb higher back here
runners.spotlight: Two wins this spring took his Lingfield AW record to 3-3; not so effective at Chelmsford last time; registered sole turf success over C&D but faces a harder task off 15lb higher back here.

quotes.race: Download The Racecourse App Raceday Ready Handicap
quotes.quote: Mister Mojito is still improving. I was a little disappointed with him last time at Newmarket, I don't think the ground was an issue, I just think he ended up getting behind the wrong horse and tactically we got it wrong. He came out of the race really well and I would have been a little bit disappointed if he wasn't involved today. He doesn't like soft ground but other than that he's not let us down - Terry Kent, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Jackson Street
runners.comment: Down the field in both runs for new stable and turf record is unconvincing
runners.spotlight: AW winner in December for previous yard; down the field in both outings for new stable and latest effort took his turf form figures to 9666800; opposed.

2:25.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.9) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.25 & 2.55 +10yds)

runners.name: Raqisa
runners.breeder: Minster Stud And Mrs H Dalgety
runners.comment: Good chance if combination of new trip and return to Yarmouth prompts a revival
runners.spotlight: Defied a 3lb higher mark two years ago in sole Yarmouth start (11.5f); lightly raced since and recent AW form is unconvincing; good chance if combination of new trip and return to this venue prompts a revival.

runners.name: Principessa
runners.comment: Hurdles winner; weak claims on Flat form but may improve off her opening mark
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo who scored over hurdles last August and had wind surgery since running poorly in September; has weak claims on Flat form but may improve off her opening mark; heed the market signals.

runners.name: Cherry Cola
runners.comment: Record of 2-4 at Yarmouth includes a win (off 2lb higher) in this race two years ago
runners.spotlight: Losing run is mounting up but she's attractively treated and interesting back at Yarmouth; record of 2-4 at this venue includes a win (off 2lb higher) in this race two years ago, the last time she raced here.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Daily Free Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Cherry Cola was down in grade and likes the track and the ground so things just fell into place for her. Rose Dawes was in the right place on the rail and did it well - Sheena West, trainer.

runners.name: Two Plus Two
runners.comment: Better than ever since returned to turf and now bids for a hat-trick; respected
runners.spotlight: Regular slow-starter on AW but has broken better and made all in two races (1m6f/11.5f) since returned to turf, looking better than ever; scored comfortably at Bath last week and commands respect under a penalty (future mark 1lb higher).

runners.name: Hidden Pearl
runners.owner: The Sisters Of Mercy & John Berry
runners.comment: Last two attempts over C&D resulted in reappearance wins in 2023 and 2024; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Absent since a heavy defeat on AW in December; however, last two attempts over C&D resulted in reappearance wins in 2023 and 2024; clear possibilities returned to this scenario on seasonal debut.

runners.name: Smokey Malone
runners.comment: In good form on AW of late; beaten in this race for the last two years
runners.spotlight: Continued his good spell on AW with Chelmsford win last time; hasn't won on turf since 2022 and was beaten in this race for the last two years (second in 2023, fifth in 2024) but is lower in the weights now.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Classified Stakes (Div II)
quotes.quote: I'm absolutely thrilled, it's really nice to get the monkey off our backs. We've only been going from the 1st of January and we haven't had much to run. We weren't really expecting much tonight but what a legend Smokey Malone is, he always gets us out of trouble and he's Dylan's [Hogan, jockey] favourite horse as well - Shelley Birkett, joint-trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Dereham
runners.comment: One of three C&D-winning 9yos in the field; gained the success in this contest in 2021
runners.spotlight: One of three C&D-winning 9yos in the field; gained the success in this contest four years ago and overall record at Yarmouth reads 123; fighting chance off current mark back here on seasonal debut.

runners.name: Wannabeawallaby

prev_owners.owner: Catch Us If You Can Racing & Dylan Cunha

runners.comment: Maiden; 6l behind Two Plus Two last time but now gets 11lb pull with that rival
runners.spotlight: Maiden who has several pieces of form that put him in the picture, most recently close second at Bath in April; finished 6l behind Two Plus Two at Salisbury since but now gets an 11lb pull with that rival.

runners.name: Trackman
runners.comment: Placed in classified events here last summer; inconsistent since and remains a maiden
runners.spotlight: Placed in two low-grade classified events at Yarmouth last summer; inconsistent since and remains a maiden; chance partly depends on whether Silvestre De Sousa (up for first time) makes a difference.

runners.name: Desejada
runners.comment: Maiden whose form claims are far from solid
runners.spotlight: Maiden whose form claims are far from solid; failed to beat a rival the last twice (AW); the least appealing contender.

5:00.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 5.9) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.25 & 2.55 +10yds)

runners.name: Visibility
runners.owner: Paul J Dixon J Wylam & Mrs C J Wylam
runners.comment: Ran creditably last Saturday when bidding for a Thirsk double; remains in form
runners.spotlight: Has registered most wins on AW but ran creditably last Saturday when bidding for a Thirsk (1m) double; this 8yo remains in form and is still well treated on historical data.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Sunday Series Handicap
quotes.quote: We always knew Visibility had a lot of ability, he can be a bit hard to catch right but everything worked out well today. I never doubted he'd be as effective on turf - Scott Dixon, trainer

runners.name: Artificer
runners.comment: Has shown improvement in last three races; 1-1 under Fred Daly; solid contender
runners.spotlight: Has shown improvement in last three races, producing form figures of 212 (gained the win on AW; sole start under Fred Daly); ran creditably at Doncaster (again over 1m) most recently; solid contender.

runners.name: Anglo Saxson
runners.comment: Successful off 2lb higher in this race in 2023; runner-up over C&D last week; big player
runners.spotlight: Successful four times at Yarmouth, including in this race (off 2lb higher) two years ago; finished second, beaten just over 1l, when favourite for C&D contest last week; nicely handicapped and looks a leading player.

quotes.race: Quinnbet Second To The Favourite Handicap
quotes.quote: Anglo Saxson is a great horse to have in the yard and is a great work horse. He's done amazing since he came over from Ireland. He was sent off favourite again and we took the visor off him and it made the difference. We rode him differently and it worked - Patrick Owens, trainer.

runners.name: Spring Festival
runners.comment: In-form maiden; bred to do better yet, being half-brother to four winners for his owners
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; ran well at Pontefract on reappearance then wasn't disgraced at Ripon (again over 1m) four days ago; bred to do better yet, being half-brother to four winners for his owners; not ruled out.

runners.name: Mickey Mongoose
runners.comment: Creditable third over C&D last week; ties in closely with Anglo Saxson on that effort
runners.spotlight: Record is 3-35, the most recent success on AW in February; creditable third over C&D last week and ties in closely with Anglo Saxson on that effort; Billy Loughnane is again on board; enters calculations.

runners.name: No News
runners.comment: Both wins at Kempton; modest sixth at Brighton last time; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Gained both wins at Kempton (7f, AW) in winter 2023-24; modest sixth at Brighton (1m) returned to turf last time, taking record in this sphere to 0-7; not the percentage call.

runners.name: Hinitsa Bay
runners.comment: May do better now handicapping over a new trip; market support should be heeded
runners.spotlight: Holds weak claims on his sprint efforts but may do better now handicapping over a new trip on second run back from lengthy absence; market support should be heeded.

runners.name: Boleyn Forever
runners.comment: Has achieved nothing in terms of form
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who has achieved nothing in terms of form; the least likely winner.

6:50.race_name: Watch Live Racing At bet365 Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)

runners.name: Open Road
runners.comment: A belated debut for this now-gelded son of Teofilio but he's well related
runners.spotlight: A belated debut for this now-gelded son of Teofilio but he's a brother to high-class 1m2f/1m3f performer West Wind Blows and the market needs checking.

runners.name: Perry Mason
runners.comment: Positives to take from both his runs and today's longer trip won't be an issue
runners.spotlight: Beaten under 3l by the classy Kikkuli in a Newmarket 7f maiden in April 2024 when with Jane Chapple-Hyam; went down by 12l on stable debut (having been gelded) at Doncaster (7f) but that was a fair race and he should improve; plenty of stamina in dam's side of pedigree; has a tricky draw to overcome here.

runners.name: Senor Cortez
runners.comment: Modest bumper form and has unsurprisingly struggled in two 1m2f novices on the AW
runners.spotlight: Modest bumper form and has unsurprisingly struggled in two 1m2f novices on the AW; similar scenario likely here.

runners.name: Miss Tinkerbell
runners.comment: Well held in three bumpers and this dimunitive mare lacks scope for improvement
runners.spotlight: No closer than 12l in three bumpers (twice blinkered) and this dimunitive mare lacks scope for improvement.

runners.name: Antipodes
runners.comment: 130,000gns yearling; makes belated debut in a hood and likely best watched
runners.spotlight: 130,000gns yearling; sixth foal; half-brother to four winners including Mackaar (8.6f/1m2f; RPR 101), Lexington Belle (Listed-placed 7f-8.6f; 96) and Shinji (bumper/2m hurdle); dam unplaced 7f/10.5f in France (66); makes belated debut in a hood and likely best watched.

runners.name: Belaya River
runners.comment: Beaten double-digit lengths in 1m2f races at Nottingham and here; one for handicaps
runners.spotlight: Beaten double-digit lengths in 1m2f races at Nottingham and here; one for handicaps.

runners.name: Believe In Success
runners.comment: Twice well beaten and has weak form claims in a race of this nature
runners.spotlight: Twice well beaten and has weak form claims in a race of this nature.

runners.name: Deauville Blue
runners.breeder: Attiyah, I E I, Castillon, Prairies
runners.comment: Sufficient promise in last season's two outings to believe there are races in him
runners.spotlight: Encouraging eighth of 20 at Newbury last May (6f, good; 20-1) and then midfield in a tough sales race next time (extended 6f); should stay the extra distance and has races in him; now gelded and has moved to a new yard (same owners).

runners.name: Dors Dream
runners.comment: Second foal out of a 1m AW/1m2f turf winner (RPR 65); gelded ahead of debut
runners.spotlight: Second foal out of a 1m AW/1m2f turf winner (RPR 65) and half-sister to French 10.5f/1m4f winner Law Of Logic; gelded ahead of debut and wouldn't be the obvious answer.

runners.name: Explode
runners.comment: Third at Kempton despite a wide trip and the front two have won since
runners.spotlight: 200,000euros yearling; endured a wide trip at Kempton (1m; 18-1) so did well to finish where he did in third and the front two have both won since; every chance.

runners.name: Grand Harbour
runners.comment: Beaten 19l and 12l in two 7f races and handicaps are going to be more like it
runners.spotlight: Beaten 19l and 12l in two 7f races and handicaps are going to be more like it.

runners.name: Mudbir
runners.comment: Encouraging second at Newmarket in Oct; fully expected to improve on that form this season
runners.spotlight: Kingman colt who is a sibling to some smart horses for these connections; got outpaced before running on well at Newmarket in October (7f, soft) and fully expected to improve on that form this season; promising.

runners.name: Royal Emblem
runners.comment: Related to useful winners but has been gelded and can only be watched
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-brother to winners Compliant (1m2f/1m3f; RPR 85), Royal Appointment (UAE 5f dirt; 80) and Sealed Offer (7f; 76); dam 7f winner (101), sister to BC Filly & Mare Turf winner Queen's Trust; has been gelded; can only be watched.

runners.name: Sea Robbo Run
runners.comment: 62,000gns yearling; now gelded; would need to see confidence behind him
runners.spotlight: 62,000gns yearling; ninth foal; brother to winners Space Traveller (5f-1m; RPR 114) and Rubia Bella (6f; 78) and half-brother to winners Pellucid (6f/6.5f; 93) and My Silent Song (1m; 84); dam 1m4f winner (76); gelded; would need to see confidence behind him.

runners.name: Take The A Train
runners.comment: Uncompetitive in 1m races at Newmarket and Southwell, sent off at 150-1 and 66-1
runners.spotlight: Uncompetitive in 1m races at Newmarket and Southwell, sent off at 150-1 and 66-1 respectively.

runners.name: Team Player
runners.comment: Second foal; half-brother to 1m2f Flat (RPR 75) and 2m/2m1f hurdle winner Continuance
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-brother to 1m2f Flat (RPR 75) and 2m/2m1f hurdle winner Continuance; dam 1m/1m2f winner (92), half-sister to 1m winner Storting; has been gelded; goes in against some talented horses on his debut.

runners.name: Saligo Bay

prev_owners.owner: Ballylinch Stud, P Inglett & N Jones

runners.comment: Struggling over hurdles and this C&D also raise a few questions; passed over
runners.spotlight: Won twice on the Flat for previous yards (both at about 1m4f on good and good to firm) but hasn't got going for this one yet, including AW, and was beaten a long way on his last two hurdle outings; Eireann Cagney a positive booking but this 7yo now makes his first start over 1m2f for well over two years with plenty to prove.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: This is a better track for Saligo Bay than Chester and he deserved a win, although he wants a bit of dig in the ground. He'd stay further, but I think we'll stay at a mile and a half and hopefully he'll improve and win another, while I think he's the type who would do well hurdling - Roger Charlton, trainer.

runners.name: Ciotog
runners.comment: Moderate runs in two starts here and needs to prove this longer trip suits
runners.spotlight: Won at Wolverhampton (8.5f) in January and he turned in a respectable effort when third over that C&D on his penultimate run; not so good next time and he ran moderately in two previous starts here, while he also needs to prove this longer trip suits.

runners.name: Moonlit Cloud
runners.comment: Trip fine but ended last year with a whimper and her three starts here have yielded little
runners.spotlight: All four wins on turf at 1m2f, most recently last May, and she's now below that winning mark; ended last year with a whimper, however, and her three starts here have yielded little.

runners.name: Meadram
runners.comment: Two wins and a narrow second on his last three C&D runs, all under this jockey; big player
runners.spotlight: Four starts over C&D have brought him two wins and two narrow seconds, the last three under Alice Tregoning; turning into a course specialist and a 3lb rise for the latest of them in March should not prevent another big run.

runners.name: Crafter
runners.breeder: J Hanly, A Stroud & Skymarc Farm
runners.comment: Good chance if he can transfer his solid Lingfield form to this venue (course debut)
runners.spotlight: Has shown best AW form at Lingfield over 1m2f; solid second under Tilly Evans there most recently (thriving winner has advertised the form since); good chance if he can transfer that form to this venue (first start here).

runners.name: Alazwar
runners.comment: Regressed last year, including on AW; career-low mark but has a question to answer now
runners.spotlight: Regressed last year, both on turf and AW, including under Brodie Hampson; now returns from a 220-day break off a career-low mark with a question to answer; course debut.

quotes.race: Thoroughbred Industry Employee Awards Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Alazwar has been knocking on the door and running very consistently in these amateur races. He's Brodie's favourite horse, so it means a lot to her. He's proved himself very versatile when it comes to trip this year and he's great for these kind of races - Archie Watson, trainer.

quotes.race: Extra Places Any Day With Betfair Handicap
quotes.quote: Alazwar is a lovely horse who's quite progressive on his day - when he's good he's good. I was surprised he handled ground so quick, but he bounced off it. The mile was perfect for him - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: Racing TV "Junior" National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Alazwar is a gorgeous horse that has always shown a lot of class at home. I've not had much to do with him and Brodie (Hampson) has been in charge throughout his training. He has done that very well in the manner of a good horse. Gavin Sheehan said he was very professional. I don't think he will benefit from running in another of those under a penalty so all being well he will go straight to the Listed Bumper at Cheltenham on New Year's Day - Archie Watson, trainer.

runners.name: Egoiste
runners.comment: C&D winner; fourth of four last time but that was messy and he should do better this time
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; two solid efforts over C&D this year and he won a 1m4f handicap at Kempton in April; last of four over C&D (Dubai Immo third) under Guy Mitchell 21 days ago, but that was a messy affair and this bigger field should help; chance.

stable_tour.quote: He's been the star of the winter, having improved 16lb in eight runs. We love him, but I think the handicapper was a little bit nasty by putting him up 8lb for winning at Wolverhampton the other day in a race where he could've been flattered. I hope he's right and he's a real improver who knows how to win races. I'm very proud of what he's achieved in his purple patch. 11-04-24

runners.name: Blackwaterfoot
runners.comment: Makes his handicap debut up in trip with Simon Walker booked; could be interesting
runners.spotlight: Most of his family were campaigned in US but his one British-based sibling did win here; not much to show for three qualifying runs on AW at about 1m, the last two for this yard, but he now makes his handicap debut up in trip with Simon Walker booked; that last point alone makes him of interest.

runners.name: Star Start
runners.comment: AW form is yet to match his best on turf but has won under Charli Parker; had wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Returned to form when scoring at Ripon (1m3f) in August and was good front-running third at York (1m2f, good to soft) next time, both times ridden by Charli Parker; finished last term quietly on soft and his AW form is yet to match his best on turf; had wind surgery ahead of this reappearance.

stable_tour.quote: A Ripon winner last year off a mark of 58, he has recently had a wind operation and won't be back until June. He's one for apprentices and amateurs, in particular our very own Charli Parker, who was on board at Ripon. He's versatile as regards trip andound. 09-04-25

runners.name: Dubai Immo
runners.comment: C&D winner and not beaten far last time under Megan Trainor; should be thereabouts again
runners.spotlight: Off the mark for this stable with a ready win last month (form strongly franked by the runner-up; took record over C&D to 2-2); beaten less than 2l on his third C&D outing (Egoiste behind) three weeks ago, when partnered by Megan Trainor; thereabouts.

stable_tour.quote: He is unlucky to still be a maiden after five runs with form figures of 23224 illustrating how genuine he is. He ran well last time at Nottingham over 1m½f when only beaten a length, and with the winner rated 82 he is a high 70s performer already. I think he is better with a little cut in the ground - in fact the softer the better. We will stick to a mile, and I expect him to opening his account sooner rather than later. 25-05-22

runners.name: Smooth Silesie
runners.comment: Five wins last year, including C&D; could progress again this year and Rossa Ryan booked
runners.spotlight: Five wins last year, including C&D, and she ended 2024 with a near-miss at Wolverhampton (winner was ahead of her mark); 143-day absence to overcome but Rossa Ryan has been booked (beaten a nose over C&D last October on his one other ride on her) and she could have more to offer in 2025.

runners.name: Twilight Madness
runners.owner: P R Hedger & P C F Racing Ltd
runners.comment: Down in weights and seems to retain ability after a year off; good course record; claims
runners.spotlight: Had a year off prior to returning to action last month; similar form in three runs this year and he could be building to something bigger; four thirds and two seconds from his six course visits; big player.

quotes.race: BetUK Over 40,000 Live Streamed Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Twilight Madness gave me a really good feel up to halfway but the horse who was making it couldn't really take me far enough and he was dossing a bit once in front - Jason Hart, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Jojo Rabbit
runners.owner: Grange Park Racing Xiii & Ruth Carr
runners.comment: Good mark on last year's best; needs to step up on 2025 efforts but that's quite possible
runners.spotlight: 5lb lower than for his Doncaster win (5.5f, soft) last summer; yet to find his very best in two runs this year but has the ability to feature.

quotes.race: Watch Royal Ascot On Sky Sports Racing Novice Stakes
quotes.quote: Jojo Rabbit got a nice lead this time rather than at Lingfield where he made the running and got hassled out of it. He's a nice type - Hollie Doyle, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: Found things a bit tight on the rail at Wolverhampton on Monday but ran on to be just behind the leaders. 09-04-25

runners.name: Agostino
runners.comment: These conditions are optimal and he returns from a break on a feasible mark; contender
runners.spotlight: 3-9 at Chelmsford (placed on four other occasions) as opposed to 0-24 elsewhere; C&D win in October was followed by a fine second to an improver three weeks later; tame end to 2024 but returning to this track could see him return with a bang.

runners.name: Buraback
runners.comment: C&D win last month; drawn widest when disappointing at Wolverhampton since
runners.spotlight: Won twice at Wolverhampton in January and he got back on the scoresheet with a C&D win last month, coming from off the pace; last of seven at Wolverhampton last month but not beaten far and probably still in form.

quotes.race: Watch Racing Free Online At Coral Handicap
quotes.quote: We've always liked Buraback but he's had issues with the bend here in the past and I told John Egan to get something on his outer this time. He got a nice run up the straight and maybe we'll run him on a straighter track next time - John Best, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's new to the yard from Jessica Macey and has had just one run for us when down the field at Wolverhampton. He had a few small issues, which we have ironed out, and the plan is to go down the turf route now. Hopefully when he gets on the grass he'll start to find some improvement. 22-03-23

runners.name: Dark Side Prince
runners.comment: Five-time C&D winner; promise on penultimate run before stretched by 6f latest; solid
runners.spotlight: Five-time C&D winner; third over C&D on penultimate start and looked stretched by 6f three weeks ago; well drawn and should be in the thick of it again.

runners.name: Zola Power
runners.comment: Yet to beat a rival in three runs for new stable; too much to prove for now
runners.spotlight: AW winner for Mick Appleby last season; big prices and yet to beat a rival in three runs for Robert Cowell; too much to prove for now.

runners.name: Colors Of Freedom
runners.comment: Better on AW than turf so latest run excusable; reappearance was promising; chance
runners.spotlight: Six-time AW winner at other tracks; promising return to action at Wolverhampton last month and her lacklustre effort at Lingfield (5f, good to firm) is easy to excuse given she's yet to offer anything on turf; drawn widest but not ruled out.

quotes.race: talkSPORT Download The App Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Colours of Freedom has taken a little while to come to hand and I think that stiffer 6f has really played to her strengths. She's off a basement mark, so hopefully she can have a productive winter - Luke Morris, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

6:20.race_name: Racing Value At bet365 Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Al Durry
runners.comment: 3-1 for Lingfield (7f) debut; creditable 3rd and should leave the form behind
runners.spotlight: Dam won Grade 1 in the US; just 3-1 to make a winning debut at Lingfield (7f) in April, against rivals who had already shown plenty of promise, and although not up to that task she should leave the form well behind.

runners.name: Amelia Sedley
runners.comment: Didn't show enough in either 7f start on the AW as a 2yo to make her of interest this time
runners.spotlight: Big prices and she didn't show enough in either 7f start on the AW as a 2yo to make her of interest this time; hood fitted.

runners.name: Beauty Beyond
runners.comment: Raced prominently but others had the legs of her on 1m debut at Newcastle; can improve
runners.spotlight: By Dubawi out of a Listed winner at 7f; raced prominently but others had the legs of her in the closing stages on Newcastle AW (1m; 13-2) this month; from a leading yard and should come on plenty.

runners.name: Bun Bang Fai
runners.comment: Two respectable efforts on AW, at 1m and 1m1f; might find return to 1m suits best for now
runners.spotlight: Two very respectable efforts on Tapeta, at 1m and 1m1f, although the latter effort came when dictating an ordinary pace; this trip may suit best for now; not far away.

runners.name: Danza Parigina
runners.comment: Sibling won twice at 1m on AW; might be better for the run
runners.spotlight: By Wooded; out of Italian Group-placed 1m2f-1m3f winner who bred four winners, including Made In Italy who won twice at 1m on AW, also placed in Italian Oaks; worth a market check but might be better for the run.

runners.name: El Fox
runners.comment: Good late work on 7f debut at Yarmouth but well beaten last July and off since
runners.spotlight: Never in the picture on Yarmouth debut (7f) last July but she did put in some nice late work; failed by a long chalk to run to the same level later that month and off since; has potential and worth a market check.

runners.name: Eternal Blessing
runners.comment: 310,000euros yearling; highly tried on Ascot debut (1m) but showed clear signs of promise
runners.spotlight: 310,000euros yearling; out of AW and Listed winner at 1m4f; highly tried on sole 2yo start at Ascot (1m) in September and although she was never involved there were clear signs of promise; interesting contender.

runners.name: Jazzy Baby
runners.comment: Dam bred 5 AW winners, including a multiple scorer; more likely to be a handicap prospect
runners.spotlight: Expert Eye filly out of unraced mare who bred five successful AW winners, including multiple scorer Petite Jack (1m2f-1m4f), along with Stacey Racey for this yard; seems likely to be more of a handicap prospect.

runners.name: Magdalayna
runners.comment: Not shown enough in 1m and 1m2f novices to put her in the reckoning at this level
runners.spotlight: Has not shown enough in two novices, at Newbury (1m) and on Lingfield AW (1m2f) to put her in the reckoning at this level.

runners.name: Making Moves
runners.comment: From the family of Coronation Cup winner Ask; likely one for another day
runners.spotlight: Aclaim filly out of half-sister to German 7.5f Listed winner Making Trouble, out of half-sister to Coronation Cup winner Ask; yard 2-32 in AW maidens; likely one for another day.

runners.name: Participle
runners.comment: Choicely bred filly; just failed to get up against subsequent Listed winner in August
runners.spotlight: By Frankel out of a half-sister to top-class Kingman; lots to like about her Salisbury debut (1m, good to firm) in August where she kept on stoutly and was only just denied by a more experienced subsequent Listed winner; should have no problem finding a maiden.

runners.name: Stellenbosch
runners.comment: Solid start to career as 2yo; plucky 2nd on return (7f); lesser run since; stamina query
runners.spotlight: Solid start to career when placed over 6f and 7f as 2yo and she returned from a layoff with a plucky effort at Newmarket (7f) in April, refusing to lie down once headed; a quick reappearance didn't go so well at Yarmouth and she has stamina to prove this time.

runners.name: True Colors
runners.comment: Kept on well over 1m on Newcastle AW on debut; not see out 1m1f next time; now back at 1m
runners.spotlight: A step up in trip looked justified after her keeping-on debut third over 1m on Newcastle AW but she didn't see out the extended 1m1f at Wolverhampton since; very likely to be competitive back at 1m; one of three for yard.

runners.name: Star Legend
runners.comment: Running creditably on Flat; close third over hurdles at Huntingdon on Tuesday
runners.spotlight: Made his breakthrough on the Flat when scoring by a head over 1m6f here in March under Mason Paetel; two close calls earlier in the year, including over C&D, and he ran creditably from the front in another C&D race on latest Flat start; finished a close third over hurdles at Huntingdon on Tuesday.

stable_tour.quote: He was quite a shock winner at Fakenham last time but he'd just dropped into a lower grade. He does really well around Fakenham, which is really nice as it's a track I love supporting. We've just set up a syndicate to sell him to more local people, which will mean he'll keep running at local tracks like Fakenham and Huntingdon. 01-01-25

runners.name: Night Horn
runners.comment: 0-6 for Andrew Balding; well beaten after a layoff on his only start for new yard
runners.spotlight: 0-6 for Andrew Balding, the pick when front-running second of five in 1m6f handicap at Sandown last June; sold for 7,000gns last July, gelded and well beaten in February on his only start for new yard; tongue tied last four starts for his former yard and again today.

runners.name: Grand Duchess Olga
runners.comment: Won at Wolverhampton last month; going back up 2lb should not prevent another bold show
runners.spotlight: Usually ridden these days by Chloe Lyons; fully effective here and she also scored at Kempton (2m) last June and Wolverhampton (1m6f) last month; going back up 2lb should not prevent another bold show.

runners.name: Sullivan Bay

prev_owners.owner: L J Williams & J D Packer Syndicate

runners.comment: In good form on the AW before pulled up over hurdles in February; wind surgery last month
runners.spotlight: In good form on the AW for his new stable in the autumn/winter, winning over 1m6f here on first occasion and also showing he stays 2m; pulled up back over hurdles in February and not seen since; had wind surgery (his second) late last month; seriously involved if straight back to form but has more to prove with today's blinkers returning instead of a visor.

runners.name: Stretch
runners.comment: No significant impact after six races, three in handicaps; 8lb lower than handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Yet to make a significant impact after six races, the last three of them in handicaps over 1m2f (here), 2m and 1m4f; tailed off in September latest; 8lb lower than on handicap debut.

8:50.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At bet365 Handicap

runners.name: Bizarre Law
runners.comment: Dropped back to 7f to win latest and looks well treated under a 5lb penalty; player.
runners.spotlight: 1m4f turf, 1m Polytrack and 7f Tapeta winner, the last of those coming at Wolverhampton when dropping back in trip latest; cheekpieces (worn last five starts) retained and he looks well treated with a 5lb penalty if able to repeat that latest effort.

runners.name: Bold Suitor

prev_owners.owner: N T Heung Yee Kuk Syndicate

runners.comment: 4lb higher than last win but was competitive from this mark at Kempton latest; contender.
runners.spotlight: 7f winner elsewhere who has scored twice here over 1m; in good form; 4lb higher than his last win but was competitive from this mark at Kempton latest; contender.

runners.name: Eight Mile
runners.comment: 1m Polytrack winner; below par on first two starts for this trainer; others preferred.
runners.spotlight: 6f turf and 1m Polytrack winner; well below par on his first two starts for this trainer; others preferred.

stable_tour.quote: I own him with a friend and he's a great staple of the yard. He leads a lot of the two-year-olds up at home and we just run him when he looks in good form. Our apprentice Liam Wright and our amateur Lillie May get a lot of practice on him and he pays his way. He's picked up some wins along the way, and I think he'll win again for sure. 29-03-24

runners.name: Heerathetrack
runners.comment: C&D winner; competitive from this mark in two of his last three starts; each-way player.
runners.spotlight: 7f and 1m course winner, the latter coming when 4lb lower in March; has been competitive from this mark in two of his three subsequent starts; each-way player.

runners.name: Kranjcar
runners.comment: Best AW efforts have been on Tapeta but not ruled out returning to this surface.
runners.spotlight: Arrives in career-best form from the turf, having won at Redcar (6f, good to firm) and Brighton (7f, good to firm) in two of his last three starts; up another 2lb; best two AW efforts have been on Tapeta but he can't be ruled out returning to this surface given recent efforts.

runners.name: Ballybaymoonshiner
runners.comment: Handy mark if able to return to the form of his penultimate effort at Kempton in January.
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; below his best here (1m) when last seen in February but he is on a handy mark if able to return to the form of his penultimate effort at Kempton in January; not written off.

runners.name: Due Date
runners.owner: A Bangs & Miss J A Challen
runners.comment: Yet to win beyond 6f; worth another try at 7f but will need to raise the bar some more.
runners.spotlight: Yet to win beyond 6f (has done so twice here); has held his form reasonably well over that trip on his last four starts; drops 1lb; dam placed over this trip, so worth another try but will need to raise the bar some more.

runners.name: Lion Ring
runners.comment: Handy mark if producing his best but unable to do so over 7f on his last two starts.
runners.spotlight: Four-time course winner over shorter; inconsistent so far in 2025; handy mark if producing his best but hasn't been able to do so over 7f on his last two starts.

runners.name: Kessaar Power

prev_owners.owner: Paul Kwok, Angel Li & Orbital Racing Group

runners.comment: 6f and 1m course winner; below par over C&D latest; handy mark and not ruled out each-way.
runners.spotlight: 6f and 1m course winner; usually races prominently; below par over C&D latest; on a handy mark and not ruled out each-way.

runners.name: Darlo Lady
runners.comment: Three moderate efforts over 5f-7f in qualifying for her handicap mark and can only watch.
runners.spotlight: Three moderate efforts over 5f-7f in qualifying for her handicap mark and can only watch.

runners.name: Spirit La Adelita
runners.comment: Unplaced in eight starts, the last two for this stable; others preferred.
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in eight starts, the last two for this stable; others preferred.

runners.name: Doves Of Peace
runners.comment: 6f winner; stays 7f; needs to be much better than on his three starts for this trainer.
runners.spotlight: 6f course winner last August, when 4lb higher; stays 7f; needs to be much better than on his three starts for this trainer in 2025.

runners.name: Shades Of May
runners.comment: Placed here (6f); handy mark based on his best form last year but below par latest.
runners.spotlight: Placed over 5f (soft) and here over 6f; handy mark based on his best form last year, even from 1lb 'wrong' but he'll need to be much better than on his reappearance at Southwell (5f, Tapeta).

runners.name: Kalik
runners.comment: Gone downhill since a promising debut and he's drawn wide; tongue-tie goes on
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut at Newbury (5f, soft) in April 2023 but it's been downhill since, including on AW (6f) and when making his handicap debut at Lingfield (5f, good to firm) 12 days ago; widest stall and he's now tried in a tongue-tie.

stable_tour.quote: He disappointed a little bit on his second run having run very well the first time out at Newbury. He proved to be a little bit gassy. He's a huge, big two-year-old so we gave him a bit of a break and had him gelded. He's back in full training now and we're very happy with him and would expect to have him out before the end of the season. We don't have any lofty ambitions and want to pitch him in at the right level and win a race with him. He stands 16.2hh and can't have been at his full strength early on so he'll improve as he matures. 21-09-23

runners.name: Temple Bruer
runners.comment: Last two wins over C&D, latterly off today's mark; respectable last time; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: His last two wins came over C&D, the latest in February off today's mark; well below par in two subsequent starts but he was better returned to this C&D last time, when fourth, beaten just under 3l (fifth won next time); not ruled out.

quotes.race: Meriel Tufnell Apprentice Handicap
quotes.quote: Temple Bruer was very brave to go through that gap late on. I was waiting for it to come and he did it very easily. They've done a very good job with him at home. He galloped through the line and enjoyed the ground - Taylor Fisher, rider.

runners.name: Dark Dreamer
runners.comment: Good run when fourth over 7f here last time; return to this trip looks a plus; player
runners.spotlight: Won off 5lb higher at Nottingham last June (has also won on AW); returned to form on his third start for this yard when fourth of 15 here (his first try at 7f) last month; lost two places late that day so this return to 6f should suit; player.

runners.name: Bill Plumb
runners.comment: Flopped last time but that might have come too soon and he could bounce back
runners.spotlight: 3-12 on AW and he's also run well here, including when second in a first-time tongue-tie this month; however, he was slowly away when favourite and last of six over C&D one week later; possibly that came too soon and he could bounce back.

runners.name: Gundogan
runners.comment: Struggling this year but returning blinkers, declining mark and Rossa Ryan are positives
runners.spotlight: Won Carlisle novice (6f, good) last summer in first-time blinkers; below form in three runs this year, including on AW and latterly when beating one home on his stable debut last time; returning blinkers, declining mark and the Rossa Ryan booking are the positives.

runners.name: Combustion
runners.comment: 4-5 on the AW this year with excuses last time; could still be improving; big player.
runners.spotlight: 4-5 on AW since returning in January, including a win over C&D; only second last time but he had excuses (blindfold off late) and the winner's won since (as has the fifth and sixth); no reason to think his progression has plateaued; big player.

runners.name: Yoshimi
runners.comment: Two course wins over 7f but has a question to answer after a poor return last month
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins since October, including here over 7f (second win over that C&D) and over 6f at Southwell; poor effort at the latter track last time, however, when returning from a 95-day break, and has a question to answer now.

runners.name: Safari Dream
runners.comment: Broke a losing spell when making all at Salisbury last week; unpenalised and O Murphy up
runners.spotlight: 0-6 on AW but he ran respectably over 7f here in March; broke a long losing spell when comfortably making all at Salisbury (6f, good to firm) one week ago; unpenalised for that apprentice race win and Oisin Murphy takes over; officially 8lb well in.

stable_tour.quote: He was a good two-year-old but had a foot injury which knocked his confidence a little bit but he's become well handicapped. 11-07-24

runners.name: Forever Noah
runners.comment: Hasn't been progressing and the drop back to 6f failed to spark improvement on his return
runners.spotlight: Consistent in defeat in 7f and 1m handicaps last year but he wasn't progressing and that was the case again on his reappearance at Brighton two weeks ago, when the drop back to sprinting didn't spark any improvement; others appeal more.

runners.name: Nelson Rose
runners.comment: May do better for her recent return but needs to prove this surface suits; new headgear
runners.spotlight: 0-7 on AW; best form when winning twice at Brighton (6f, good to firm) last summer, both from the front under Jason Watson; not so good on her stable debut over that C&D a fortnight ago, but she took a run to get going last year and could well do better; needs to prove this surface suits, though; cheekpieces added to her usual hood.

runners.name: Thomas Equinas
runners.comment: All five of his wins came here but not at this trip; first start at 6f since early 2023
runners.spotlight: All five wins have come here but over further, the latest off 1lb lower last October (7f); ran creditably in a competitive race two starts back and it was a good effort when second last time (also here over 7f); first start at 6f since early 2023.

runners.name: El Hibri
runners.comment: Four wins on AW over 6f, including here; forget last run; remains favourably treated
runners.spotlight: Four wins on AW over 6f, including here; two solid seconds at Kempton this year and his last run there (over 7f) can be forgiven; remains favourably treated.

7:20.race_name: Watch Live Racing At bet365 Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)

runners.name: Shimmering Spin
runners.comment: Career best over C&D on handicap debut; gelded since below par latest; can be competitive.
runners.spotlight: Returned from wind surgery and a winter break to go close on his reappearance and handicap debut over C&D in February (career best); well below that level at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) latest; since gelded; capable of being competitive on his return to this track.

runners.name: Armathia
runners.comment: 200-1 on her Flat debut and last of 12 at Doncaster (7f, good to firm) last month.
runners.spotlight: Placed in two slow ground bumpers; 200-1 on her debut in this code and last of 12 at Doncaster (7f, good to firm; first-time hood and tongue-tie) last month.

runners.name: Aqab
runners.comment: Improved latest; capable of being more competitive when upped in trip but not written off.
runners.spotlight: Sea The Stars colt who improved on his debut effort when contesting a Southwell novice event (1m, Tapeta) latest; should be capable of being more competitive when upped in trip but not written off here.

runners.name: Arabian Story
runners.comment: Showed ability on debut; can get involved if building on that effort but below par since.
runners.spotlight: Showed ability when sixth in a 7f Meydan conditions race (dirt) in January; well below that level back there (1m) when last seen; if building on his original effort he should be involved but has that to prove.

runners.name: Competizione
runners.comment: Close second to the odds-on favourite at Doncaster latest; up in trip; big player.
runners.spotlight: 25-1 and didn't appear to handle the dip on debut at Newmarket (7f, good) last month; progressed nicely for that, racing prominently and finishing a close second at Doncaster (7f, good to firm; first-time tongue-tie) latest, when succumbing only to the odds-on favourite; up in trip; big player.

runners.name: Double Meaning
runners.comment: Improved second effort last season but looks one to watch on first run for new trainer.
runners.spotlight: Made some improvement on a moderate start when fourth at Pontefract (1m2f, soft) last October; since left Charlie Appleby for 25,000gns and looks one to watch on his debut for new trainer.

runners.name: Emperors Logic
runners.comment: 66-1 on debut when last of 11 at Windsor last month; watching brief advised.
runners.spotlight: 66-1 on debut when last of 11 at Windsor (1m, good to firm) last month; watching brief advised.

runners.name: Jupiter Ammon
runners.comment: Finished 20l ninth on debut at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) last month; much more needed.
runners.spotlight: 18-1 on debut at Southwell (1m, Tapeta) last month, when racing prominently until weakening to finish a 20l ninth; much more needed.

runners.name: Kilima
runners.comment: Gelded prior to finishing 29l last of 12 on debut at Wolverhampton (1m, Tapeta).
runners.spotlight: Gelded prior to his debut at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) last month, when 80-1 and finishing last of 12 and beaten 29l.

runners.name: Mawood
runners.comment: Half-brother to two winners; dam South African 1m Group 1 winner; interesting newcomer.
runners.spotlight: Fifth foal; half-brother to winners Mujtaba (Group-placed 7.5f-1m2f; RPR 118) and Fakhama (Listed-placed 7f; 97); dam dual South African 1m Group 1 winner (stayed 1m2f; 104), out of Chilean 1,000 Guineas winner; trainer 10% with AW 3yos in recent years; no surprise to see a competitive debut.

runners.name: River King
runners.comment: This season's form over 7f/8.5f entitles him to plenty of respect; should be a big player.
runners.spotlight: Built on the promise of last year's debut when under 2l third on his reappearance in a Doncaster novice event (7f, good to firm) last month; beaten at odds-on at Nottingham (8.5f, good) latest, when the winner got first run but he stuck on well; ought to be a major player.

stable_tour.quote: He ran just once last year but has been showing up well at home and will be out in the next fortnight or so. 22-04-25

runners.name: Rolling Luck
runners.comment: Big prices and well beaten on both starts; others preferred.
runners.spotlight: Big prices and well beaten on both starts; others preferred.

runners.name: Sir Wootton
runners.comment: Gelded prior to his debut at Wetherby last month, when 14-1 and over 14l fifth.
runners.spotlight: Gelded prior to his debut at Wetherby (1m, good to firm) last month, when 14-1 and beaten over 14l into fifth; much more needed.

runners.name: Summertime Blues
runners.comment: Half-brother to five winners; trainer 19% with AW 3yos in last five seasons; interesting.
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; half-brother to five winners including Thammin (5f/6f including 2yo/AW/UAE dirt Listed; RPR 106), Ajax Tavern (6f/7f AW; 102) and A Taste Of Honey (7f AW including 2yo; 94); dam 5f-7f winner; gelded; trainer 19% with AW 3yos in last five seasons; interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Wood Whisperer
runners.comment: Half-brother to a 1m2f winner (RPR 88); trainer yet to have an AW 3yo winner; watch.
runners.spotlight: 42,000gns foal, 50,000gns yearling; second foal; half-brother to 1m2f winner Crimson Road (RPR 88); dam unplaced 6f-1m (76), closely related to 6f/7f Listed winner Rose Bonheur, out of 1m Group 3 winner; trainer yet to have an AW 3yo winner; one to watch on debut.

2:05.race_name: Francky Du Berlais Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.name: Bond Broker
runners.breeder: C A F R E Enniskellen Campus
runners.comment: Bumper/hurdle winner; should make a better chaser, given point background and his trainer
runners.spotlight: His bumper and two hurdle wins came on left-handed tracks and he hung that way at right-handed Ludlow (2m, good), where he faced no easy task under a double penalty despite going off odds-on; should make a better chaser, given a point background and his trainer.

quotes.race: MW Paving & Groundworks Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It was very straightforward on Bond Broker. He's growing up all the time - Freddie Gingell, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: After he'd run too free on his second outing in a bumper we fitted a hood next time and he won nicely. He goes novice hurdling from December onwards and seems particularly well suited by a sound surface. 04-11-24

runners.name: Handlethekettle
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner who was highly tried once; brings plenty of potential to chasing
runners.spotlight: Won two minor hurdles on either side of his remote fifth in the Grade 2 Persian War at Chepstow in October, last time making all at Taunton (2m3f, good to firm) after wind surgery; likely that he's held in some regard and brings plenty of potential to chasing.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his debut for us at Worcester and then was fifth in the Persian War. He might just need his palate tweaking before progressing. 06-11-24

runners.name: King Roly
runners.comment: Bumper/maiden winner; receiving weight off both rivals gives him a chance on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Has won a bumper and a maiden hurdle; good second in a 2m4f Perth handicap last month when tried in a tongue-tie; receiving weight off his two rivals gives him a chance on chase debut.

runners.name: Ri Na Cuirte
runners.comment: 3m2f winner late last year and solid seconds the last twice; not easily knocked
runners.spotlight: 3m2f winner late last year and solid seconds the last twice, latterly coming from well off the pace at Chepstow (2m7f, good); hard to knock.

stable_tour.quote: He was very in and out last season. He won on his seasonal reappearance at Fontwell and then ran really well at Ascot, with the form working out nicely. He schooled well over fences at home but he hated it when we sent him chasing at Taunton. We've since found he's got a kissing spine, so we're keeping him to hurdles. He ran in a novice handicap hurdle at Exeter on Friday, finishing seventh. He wants decent ground, so he'll run deep into the spring. 12-03-25

runners.name: Djo Dela Barriere
runners.comment: Plumpton win came out of the blue but has to be feared with no penalty
runners.spotlight: Hadn't been running that well but went off at only 4-1 at Plumpton 11 days ago (2m4f, good) and duly won with a bit in hand; obvious claims if in the same form, having escaped a penalty.

stable_tour.quote: I'd say he was lucky to win probably the worst novice hurdle to be run this year, at Hereford in November. I think that was good placing by the trainer! He ran okay the other day at Plumpton, when he was fourth, but his mark of 115 is very overrated and he has no chance of winning off that. He'll be a bit of sport around the country and will pick up some prize-money, but in my view he's way too high in the handicap to be winning. 24-12-24

runners.name: Karavomylos
runners.comment: Absent since September 2023 but would have every chance if retaining all his ability
runners.spotlight: Nicely consistent in six staying events once sent into handicaps, with cheekpieces working well the last twice; has been absent since September 2023 but would have every chance if retaining all his ability.

runners.name: Northern Symphonie
runners.comment: Won her last two under Sam Twiston-Davies, the latest a handicap at this trip
runners.spotlight: Won her maiden at Newton Abbot (2m5f) and then followed up with the hood left off in a Chepstow handicap (2m7f; again on good ground); only 4lb higher here and she's now 2-2 under Sam Twiston-Davies.

3:35.race_name: Welcome To The World Idris Phillips Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.name: Sir Galahad

prev_owners.owner: T A Rahman, S Siddiqui, R Gray & Partner

runners.comment: Fair Flat maiden (best RPR 72); 2-2 at about 2m over hurdles, looking promising
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat maiden (best RPR 72) who has found a new calling over hurdles, setting to work with a will when making a successful debut at Wetherby before having a straightforward task at Stratford (both about 2m, good) this month; has the useful 4yo allowance but also a big penalty; looks promising.

quotes.race: #WearAHatDay Supporting Brain Tumour Awareness Month Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was pleasantly surprised by Sir Galahad. He wasn't a bad Flat horse. When I bought him off James Ferguson he said he was a lot better than he'd been showing. He's enjoyed his jumping. He tried hard, considering he was a maiden on the Flat. He might be an above-average summer horse - Olly Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Roxanne
runners.comment: Best RPR 87 on Flat in 2024; 2-2 over hurdles, having it easy on latest; more on plate now
runners.spotlight: Three Flat wins in Germany; up and down in Britain but was involved in two close finishes in 2024 (best RPR 87); 2-2 over hurdles for new yard, having it pretty much her own way at Newton Abbot (2m1f, good) recently; Sir Galahad will provide much more of a test but it looks tight between them.

quotes.race: Abbott Risk Consulting Ltd Mares' Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was lovely, Roxanne has been really good at home. She was a bit green early on and she reached for a couple. But I was impressed that she was very neat in front, although she left her back-end in a couple, and I quite like it when they're like that. She's in for the summer - Dan Skelton, trainer.

runners.name: Ifan Full Pelt
runners.comment: 300-1 for both hurdle starts, falling on debut and finishing remote at Chepstow recently
runners.spotlight: 300-1 for both hurdle starts, falling on debut and finishing remote at Chepstow last month.

runners.name: Millsbridge
runners.comment: Big outsider for all 3 starts, well behind in two completions; yard in fine form
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure prices for all three starts, well behind in a bumper and again in sole completion over hurdles; trainer in great form but handicaps more appropriate for this one.

runners.name: Chanelle Noir
runners.comment: Glimmer of ability in bumpers but minor form over hurdles and an unlikely novice winner
runners.spotlight: Glimmer of ability in bumpers but she was well held on her hurdle debut and there was nothing new from her at Hereford recently; an unlikely novice winner.

stable_tour.quote: She's a really nice filly. Chloe Emsley, who works for me, rode her at Ascot on her debut last month, so that was nice. I said to ride her to come home strongly and she did. She was full of running at the end. She'll probably run in another bumper and then we'll see where we are with her. She'll run over hurdles before the end of the season but she needs a decent surface. She'll run deep into the spring. 12-03-25

runners.name: Sure To Please
runners.comment: Minor bumper promise; soon cried enough on hurdle debut; handicaps more likely
runners.spotlight: Minor promise in bumpers but she soon cried enough on her hurdle debut at Chepstow and of more interest when handicapping.

3:05.race_name: Merched Y Mor Mares' Handicap Chase

runners.name: Obsessedwithyou
runners.owner: Awr Consultancy Ltd & The Folly Partners
runners.comment: Quiet chase debut last time but she's a major player on the pick of her hurdle form
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who is suited by good ground; disappointingly failed to justify market confidence when a remote fourth on chase debut but she's a major player on the pick of her hurdle form; probably worth another chance over fences in this modest a contest.

stable_tour.quote: She lost her way a bit last season in the mud, but she has more to give off her handicap mark on decent ground and will jump a fence in time. 06-11-24

She started in those new junior hurdle races last season and won twice, while also finishing fourth at Listed level and in a Cheltenham Grade 3. I think she's unexposed because it might be hard for the handicapper to get a grip on those races. She's matured and strengthened, and the Grade 2 EBF mares' race at Newbury next spring could be a target for her. 28-09-23

runners.name: Calli Black
runners.comment: Offered little in handicap hurdles the last twice and hard to be confident on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Offered little in minor handicap hurdles the last twice and hard to be confident on chase debut, for all that she's a winning pointer.

runners.name: Lady Pretender
runners.comment: Not in great form of late but she does have ability and this is a very weak race
runners.spotlight: Fifteen defeats under rules include ten chases; tailed off in her last two and all her form has been on good to soft or slower ground; does have ability, though, and this is a very weak race.

runners.name: Culligran
runners.comment: Hasn't been running badly and she's back down to a good mark for this chasing debut
runners.spotlight: No further progress since winning well over hurdles at Hereford (2m, good to soft) in November but she hasn't been running badly and is back down to a good mark for this chasing debut; cheekpieces removed after one use; could have a say.

runners.name: Miss Marette
runners.comment: Refused to race three runs back and tailed off since then on either side of wind surgery
runners.spotlight: 1-20 over hurdles and 0-5 as a chaser; refused to race three runs back and tailed off since then on either side of wind surgery.

4:40.race_name: Adept GRP Cabinets Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Blue In The West
runners.comment: 0-11 over hurdles in Ireland; no match for the winner in a weak novice last weekend
runners.spotlight: Winning pointer in Ireland but went 0-11 over hurdles; questionable what he achieved on last weekend's stable debut in a 2m6f novice at Stratford as the odds-on winner won by 22l.

runners.name: Lucky Bounce
runners.comment: Ran well when last seen some 903 days ago; the market could be instructive
runners.spotlight: Returns from a mammoth absence but only narrowly failed to justify strong market support in a 2m7f handicap at Market Rasen when last seen; returns off 1lb lower; the market could be instructive.

runners.name: Little Miller
runners.comment: Modest but she did win a mares' point and makes handicap debut after wind surgery
runners.spotlight: Modest hurdle form but she did win a mares' point and makes handicap debut after wind surgery; one to note in the betting.

runners.name: Miss Popalong
runners.comment: Back from a break of 151 days to finish an 11l third over Exeter's 2m7f
runners.spotlight: Back from a break of 151 days to finish an 11l third over Exeter's 2m7f (good to firm), where she looked threatening before flattening out late on; had another 60 days away since then but looks capable of winning something like this.

runners.name: Blackacre
runners.comment: An assured stayer at this trip but he'll need to step up on his recent efforts
runners.spotlight: Placed over hurdles and fences; an assured stayer at this trip but he'll need to step up on his recent efforts (beaten 16l last time).

runners.name: Harvie Wallbanger
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late K W Bell
runners.comment: 21l defeat on h'cap debut was after an absence and now goes in cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: Essentially disappointing since finishing second in a bumper and was beaten 21l on handicap debut at Chepstow (2m3f); that was after a lengthy absence and now goes in cheekpieces over a longer trip (3m point winner).

runners.name: Junior Des Mottes
runners.breeder: E A R L Ecurie Des Mottes
runners.comment: Cheekpieces are now tried but he's unraced beyond 2m3f and 3lb out of the weights
runners.spotlight: Placed in bumpers; minor form over hurdles and was pulled up on handicap debut despite being a market springer; cheekpieces are now tried but he's unraced beyond 2m3f and 3lb out of the weights.

2:35.race_name: Adept GRP Cabinets Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Doc Mccoy

prev_owners.owner: Ian Chanin, Tom Hooper, Peter Kingwell & Mark Booth

runners.comment: Backed up his Fakenham win with a close second at Huntingdon on Tuesday
runners.spotlight: Struggled over fences earlier but was having only his fourth run over hurdles when beating three rivals at Fakenham one month ago (2m4f, good) and jumping right didn't help matters when a close second at Huntingdon on Tuesday; clear claims if turned out again.

quotes.race: Premier League Offers At Rhino.Bet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: It's a shame Doc McCoy didn't win his bumper, but he has always been a proper jumper. He is an embryonic chaser as he won a point-to-point at Great Trethew. He bowled along in front when he won his point-to-point so we thought we would let him bowl along and make it a test. We could aim him at the EBF Final at Sandown in March. That  is probably his kind of race as it suits proper staying chasers. That will probably be his target - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won on his hurdling debut before finishing fourth under a penalty, but he picked up an injury soon afterwards. He's back from a break and will go novice chasing. 06-11-24

Novice hurdling is the plan for him and he jumps well, while he performed to a good level in his bumpers, finishing in the places on all three starts. It was a shame he didn't win one, but Datsalrightgino didn't either. 28-09-23

runners.name: Kepagge
runners.comment: The return of this headgear is probably a good thing but this 11yo has too much to prove
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner in spring 2023; however, there's been little to shout about in the meantime and, while the return of this headgear is probably a good thing, this 11yo has too much to prove.

quotes.race: 888Sport Follow Us On Instagram Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: Kepagge has his quirks but he's done it nicely again under a penalty. He's jumped well in the main after doing plenty of schooling at home. He's a really nice horse - Tom Scudamore, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's not the easiest to keep together but had a really encouraging end to last season, winning two of his last three. He'll be going over fences now and wants two and a half miles. He'll be out shortly. 31-10-23

runners.name: The Flying Poet
runners.comment: Best run when second in a very modest Hexham maiden; bred to be better than this mark
runners.spotlight: The best of his three runs (hooded each time) was the near miss in a maiden at Hexham (2m4f, good); that was a very ordinary race but he has a nice pedigree; disappointing if he can't do better.

runners.name: Sassified
runners.comment: Three-time hurdle winner; every chance off this mark if on the ball after his break
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in back-to-back handicaps (2m4f/2m3f) before he was unsuited by soft ground at Exeter when last seen in December; every chance off this mark if on the ball after his break.

runners.name: The Wire Flyer
runners.comment: 66-1 winner here  this month but no surprise that he couldn't back that up last week
runners.spotlight: Won by 5l over C&D (good) this month but that was a surprise outcome at 66-1 and, rather typically, he couldn't replicate the form at Worcester since; that was under a penalty and he's now 4lb higher.

runners.name: Bluebella
runners.comment: Capable of a big run off this mark if revived by a change of scenery; stays this far
runners.spotlight: Two years since sole success in a Worcester handicap hurdle (2m, good) and she wasn't in that sort of form late last year; certainly capable of a big run off this mark if revived by a change of scenery; stays this far.

3:47.race_name: Betfred Supports Jack Berry House Handicap
3:47.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 2.17 +26yds, 4.17 +28yds and 4.52 & 5.22 +6yds)

runners.name: Blue Day
runners.comment: Won at Ascot three weeks ago on first crack at 5f; could have more to offer at this trip
runners.spotlight: Has an in-and-out profile across his last few starts but he won at Ascot (good to firm) three weeks ago when attempting 5f for the first time, beating Duran by a length and a half; now 6lb worse off with the runner-up; could have more to offer at this trip and he's a strong candidate.

runners.name: Harvanna

prev_owners.owner: Fine Claret Racing,Mrs Burke & C Wood
Fine Claret Racing & More Turf Racing
Fine Clarets Racing & Mrs E Burke

runners.comment: Went close on stable debut in December when last seen; major player if at top of her game
runners.spotlight: Three-time 5f turf winner (good to firm/good) who came from a tough position to be beaten just a neck on stable debut at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) in December; major player if at the top of her game on this first run since.

quotes.race: Juddmonte British EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Juddmonte/GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: They went a really good gallop, Harvanna stayed on nicely. She improved a lot from first time - Clifford Lee, jockey.

runners.name: Archduke Ferdinand
runners.comment: Very close fourth at Thirsk recently when denied a clear run; could well make amends
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row last August (6f, good/good to firm) and may well have won at Thirsk (5f, good) recently if he'd had a clear run; just 1lb higher today and there can be optimism he'll make amends.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Grey Horse Handicap
quotes.quote: It wasn't the plan to make the running, but Archduke Ferdinand gets seven and even a mile so I thought making the running on a front-runners track would work and he was very game out there. He went to post early as it was a new track for him as he can be a bit of a handful, but he was pretty chilled out beforehand - Alex Jary, jockey.

runners.name: Grandlad
runners.comment: 3-10 during last season's debut campaign and may have benefited from a break
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent during last season's debut campaign, which ended tamely, but he won three times (5f, AW/good) and may have benefited from a break; not ruled out in a first-time tongue-tie on his return to action.

runners.name: Duran
runners.owner: D Caslin, P Wilcock & M Cantillon
runners.comment: Runner-up off this mark on both outings this season and he's a solid contender
runners.spotlight: Progressive last year, winning three times, and he's continued the good work this season with creditable second placings off this mark at Beverley (5f, good) and Ascot (5f, good to firm), most recently a length and a half behind Blue Day with whom he's 6lb better off; solid contender.

quotes.race: Fine Details Vehicle Valeting Handicap
