quotes.quote: They went very quick - probably too fast - and Duran couldn't lay up with them early on, so we're chuffed to bits with that. That was one of the last real three-year-old-only races of the year we could go for, so we'll run him just once more for the year now - Nigel Tinkler, trainer.

runners.name: Curious Rover
runners.owner: Ursa Major Racing Ltd And Partner
runners.comment: Runner-up on two of his three starts this season and can be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his last 18 starts but often runs well, as when runner-up on two of his three outings this season; beaten just a neck at Thirsk (5f, good to firm) on Saturday and can be thereabouts off the same mark.

quotes.race: cavani.co.uk Glorious Gallop Gala Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: William (Pyle) said Curious River took him there and did it easily. He's won a couple of races now and seems to be getting quicker - Katie Scott, trainer.

quotes.race: Dave Watson Memorial/EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C & D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Curious Rover is a nice horse. He didn't show as much speed as that when we first got him so we started him off over a bit further but he's probably a right sprinter. He's learned his job nicely and progressed each time so it's perfect. We'll probably look for something under a penalty now, he's going to get a stiff enough mark - Katie Scott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A very fast gelding who won twice as a two-year-old and this season ran an absolute cracker when fifth in the 3YO Dash at Epsom on Derby day behind Blue Storm, proving that he has trained on. He was just a bit lost for a few seconds in the dip and lost momentum. Without that he could have been third, but it was still a huge run and he now goes to Chester at the end of the month - he'll take some stopping provided he gets a good draw. 14-06-24

runners.name: Brooklyn Nine Nine
runners.comment: Below his last winning mark but hasn't been at his best on his last three starts
runners.spotlight: Now 2lb lower than when winning at Southwell (5f, AW) in December and he's also effective on turf; however, he hasn't been at his best on his last three starts (AW/grass) and needs to raise his game.

quotes.race: Top Odds Every Day With BetUK Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I think Brooklyn Nine Nine just got a bit tired the last half furlong but he got the job done. I started on the outside rail but he just drifted a bit left and I think he got a bit lonely. His two runs last year were very good and I think he needed that today so he's going to come on a bit for it - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

5:22.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 2.17 +26yds, 4.17 +28yds and 4.52 & 5.22 +6yds)

runners.name: High On Hope
runners.comment: 0-9 but some good form this season (including here) and could be thereabouts
runners.spotlight: Made it 0-9 when eighth of nine at Chester a fortnight ago but wasn't beaten far having been drawn wide and suffered interference; in good form previously (including here) and could be thereabouts now back down in grade.

runners.name: Miss Collada
runners.comment: Won off this mark at Kempton (7f, AW) last November but hasn't shone on her 3 starts since
runners.spotlight: Won off this mark at Kempton (7f, AW) last November but hasn't shone on her three starts since; crashed through the rails on the way to post and withdrawn at Newmarket on Saturday (33-1 at the time).

runners.name: Mystical Storm
runners.comment: Third on all three starts; not overfaced by initial mark and open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Has run well to finish third on all three starts, over C&D on debut and on reappearance at Redcar (7f, good to firm) three weeks ago; shouldn't be overfaced by his initial mark and he's open to improvement.

runners.name: Soldiers Star
runners.comment: Couldn't get into it on turf debut at Chester but was drawn widest and is not written off
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap debut at Kempton (7f, AW) in March before fair fifth at Lingfield (6f, AW); couldn't get into it on turf debut at Chester a fortnight ago but was drawn widest and is not written off.

stable_tour.quote: He'll probably go to Lingfield on Good Friday for the valuable 0-80 handicap and I think he's progressive. He missed most of his two-year-old season but that's given him the time to strengthen and grow, and he could win plenty of races. 09-04-25

runners.name: Suhub
runners.comment: Her dam Nazeef was top-class and she has plenty of potential off her opening mark
runners.spotlight: Runner-up at Newmarket (1m, good to firm) last September on second start and another good run when third at Kempton (1m, AW) in October; her dam Nazeef was top-class and she has plenty of potential off her opening mark.

runners.name: Organ
runners.comment: Fair third on handicap debut at Newmarket and can improve if settling better
runners.spotlight: Promise among his first three starts last May-July and he returned from an absence with a fair third on handicap debut at Newmarket (7f, good) last month; can improve if settling better and he's one to consider.

runners.name: Bear Kode
runners.comment: Promise on first two starts last July; disappointing since but a break may have helped
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut at Carlisle (6f, good to firm) last July then won at Newcastle (7f, AW); disappointing on his next three outings but the subsequent break may have helped and a case can be made on his early promise.

runners.name: Ran Amok
runners.comment: Won last June on second run; down the field the next twice but returns having been gelded
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden at Chepstow (6f, good to soft) last June on his second start; down the field in a Windsor handicap and Irish sales race the next twice, but reappears having been gelded and he may be able to get back on track.

runners.name: Kamekist
runners.comment: Won on handicap debut on Wolverhampton AW but soundly beaten since on turf debut
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (6f, AW) last month and retains potential, but he was soundly beaten on his recent turf debut at Windsor (6f, good to firm) and needs to prove his effectiveness on grass.

runners.name: Invitorio
runners.owner: Grange Park Racing Xviii & Ofo Partners
runners.comment: Well beaten on AW latest but he's a possible improver now back on turf and upped in trip
runners.spotlight: Won at Redcar (6f, soft) last October on third and final 2yo start and reappeared with staying-on fourth in Pontefract handicap (6f, good); well beaten at Southwell since but that was his AW debut and he's a possible improver now back on turf and upped in trip.

runners.name: Scatter Penny
runners.comment: Step back in right direction when fifth on reappearance but well beaten the next twice
runners.spotlight: Won last summer on her first two starts and took a step back in the right direction when fifth at Pontefract on last month's reappearance; however, she's been well beaten the last twice; visor removed after one use; non-runner.

runners.name: Titian Blue
runners.comment: Displayed ability for William Haggas and new trainer does very well with stable switchers
runners.spotlight: Runner-up for William Haggas last year on two of her first three starts (6f/7f, good/AW) and soft ground may not have suited on nursery debut when last seen; sold for 45,000gns in October and new trainer does extremely well with recruits from other yards; could be on a good mark for stable debut.

2:47.race_name: Betfred "Follow Us On X" EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
2:47.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 2.17 +26yds, 4.17 +28yds and 4.52 & 5.22 +6yds)

runners.name: Boiling Over
runners.comment: 120,000euros yearling; leading northern trainer having another fine season with his 2yos
runners.spotlight: 120,000euros yearling; second foal; Lucky Vega half-brother to French 6.7f 2yo winner; unraced dam from talented family; leading northern trainer is having another fine season with his 2yos; one to consider on debut.

runners.name: First Time
runners.comment: 140,000gns yearling; should have a bright future but likely to improve for this debut run
runners.spotlight: 33,000euros foal, 140,000gns yearling; third foal; Mohaather half-brother to 1m2f winner Crimson Road (RPR 88); unplaced dam closely related to 6f/7f Listed winner Rose Bonheur, out of 1m Group 3 winner; should have a bright future and is not ruled out, but he's likely to improve for this debut.

runners.name: Golden Brown
runners.comment: Potential in pedigree and trainer does well here but he may need this debut outing
runners.spotlight: £68,000 yearling; fourth foal; Galileo Gold half-brother to winners Tiger Belle (5f 2yo including Group 3) and Black Dark (Czech 5f 2yo/1m2f); trainer does well here but his 2yos frequently need their debut runs.

runners.name: Maximized
runners.comment: £720,000 breeze-up buy; Buick rides stablemate Time To Turn but respected nevertheless
runners.spotlight: £720,000 2yo breeze-ups; fifth foal; closely related to 6f winner Benefit (including 2yo/Listed); dam 6f/7f AW winner (RPR 84) out of 6f 2yo Group 1 winner; looks the Godolphin second-string with William Buick riding stablemate Time To Turn but this Mehmas newcomer is respected nevertheless.

runners.name: Moscow Power
runners.comment: £30,000 yearling; in good hands but others make greater appeal on paper
runners.spotlight: £30,000 yearling; second foal; Sergei Prokofiev half-brother to Italian 6f winner; dam unraced half-sister to 5f Group 1 winner Makarova, out of well-bred 6f 2yo winner; in good hands but others appeal more on paper.

runners.name: This Guy
runners.comment: Beaten a long way on debut when 6-4; cost £170,000; could be a different proposition today
runners.spotlight: Green when beaten a long way on last month's debut at Newmarket (5f, good); however, he was sent off at just 6-4 and it will be no surprise if this £170,000 yearling is an entirely different proposition on this second start.

runners.name: Time To Turn
runners.comment: One of two for Godolphin; this colt looks the chief hope with William Buick on board
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam French 10.5f winner, half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Ivawood, out of 1m2f-1m4f winner; one of two for top trainer, whose 2yos are in flying form, and this Dark Angel newcomer looks the yard's chief hope with William Buick on board.

runners.name: Tuwajeri
runners.comment: £90,000 yearling; dam 6f 2yo winner from very useful family; trainer's 2yos going well
runners.spotlight: £90,000 yearling; fourth foal; dam 6f 2yo winner (RPR 81) from very useful family; trainer's 2yos are going well and this Phoenix Of Spain newcomer could be a contender, especially if strong in the betting.

4:17.race_name: Betfred Double Delight Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB/GBBPlus Race)
4:17.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 2.17 +26yds, 4.17 +28yds and 4.52 & 5.22 +6yds)

runners.name: Duchess Tattoo
runners.comment: 150-1, always behind in maiden at Ripon (1m2f, good) in April
runners.spotlight: 150-1, always behind in maiden at Ripon (1m2f, good) in April.

runners.name: Cheshire Belle
runners.comment: 32,000euros yearling; half-sister to two winners, notably Box To Box (1m2f-11.3f; RPR 102)
runners.spotlight: 24,000euros foal, 32,000euros yearling; fifth foal; Shaman half-sister to winners Box To Box (1m2f-11.3f; RPR 102) and Gormanston (7f/10.6f AW; 61); dam unplaced at 1m2f in France (56), half-sister to French 1m4f Listed winner Mahaatheer, out of 1m2f Listed winner; late foal; market can guide.

runners.name: Lady Randolph
runners.comment: Weak 16-1, always behind in maiden at Newbury (1m2f, good); a visor goes on today
runners.spotlight: 85,000gns yearling; weak 16-1, always behind in maiden at Newbury (1m2f, good) six weeks ago; had plenty to learn (a visor goes on today) and the pick of today's rivals should also prove tough.

runners.name: Pearla
runners.comment: Made most when beaten a head at Newmarket (1m2f, good) on debut, 1l ahead of Silent Love
runners.spotlight: 425,000gns yearling; Sea The Stars half-sister to French 1m1f-1m4f winner Place Du Carrousel (including Group 1 Opera; RPR 120); dam 1m4f-1m7f winner (110); Irish Oaks entry who was co-second favourite for a six-runner maiden at Newmarket (1m2f, good) three weeks ago, made most and was beaten a head; just 1l in front of Silent Love that day, on a highly promising debut.

runners.name: Silent Love
runners.comment: Closed to be 1l behind Pearla at Newmarket (1m2f, good); Buick is on Spirited Style though
runners.spotlight: By Dubawi; sister to 1m winner Whispering Words (RPR 89); dam 1m 2yo winner (including Listed; 101); co-second favourite with Pearla when third of six in a maiden at Newmarket (1m2f, good) three weeks ago, outpaced by her in the penultimate furlong but closing to within a length at the line; like that rival, she should be open to significant improvement, but William Buick is on Spirited Style instead.

runners.name: Spirited Style
runners.comment: Fine pedigree; ran on well into 2nd at Ascot (1m2f, good to firm) and Buick takes the ride
runners.spotlight: Sea The Stars filly out 1m/1m2f winner Wild Illusion (including three Group 1s; RPR 116); 5-2 for maiden at Ascot (1m2f, good to firm) 13 days ago, slowly away and green but running on well into second of ten; could be type for big improvement and William Buick rides her instead of Silent Love.

4:52.race_name: Betfred "Play Fred's £5 Million'' Fillies' Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
4:52.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 2.17 +26yds, 4.17 +28yds and 4.52 & 5.22 +6yds)

runners.name: Woroodd
runners.comment: Won by 5l at Thirsk on second start; this could be another good opportunity
runners.spotlight: Built upon the promise of last month's debut third at Newbury (7f, good) to win by 5l at Thirsk (7f, good) last time; today's race could be a good opportunity for this highly likeable filly to defy a 7lb penalty.

stable_tour.quote: She had issues that kept her off the track last year but she's been training well this spring. She was a bit keen and fresh on her debut at Newbury last week, which we weren't expecting, but she'll improve a lot for that. Hopefully we'll find a maiden for her. 16-04-25

runners.name: Cradle Of Love

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M V Magnier/Mrs P Shanahan/K MacLennan/J P Magnier

runners.comment: 0-11 but fair fourth on stable debut last month and she might not be far away
runners.spotlight: 0-11 but she showed some useful form in Ireland in cheekpieces, which go back on today, and she was a fair fourth on last month's stable and seasonal debut at Southwell (7f, AW); might not be far away.

stable_tour.quote: She has plenty of ability but threw the race away at Listowel last time. She'd have an outside chance. 12-06-24

runners.name: Dream Angel
runners.comment: Well beaten on last month's debut but no surprise if she takes sizeable step forward
runners.spotlight: 52,000gns foal whose dam is from a good family; well beaten at 12-1 on last month's debut at Wolverhampton (7f, AW) but no surprise if she takes a sizeable step forward today for her respected trainer.

runners.name: Goldie Trickett
runners.comment: Flopped on debut but cost 1,650,000euros and could be capable of considerably better
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way when 3-1 for last month's debut at Newmarket (1m, good to soft); a leap of faith is required to support her today but this 1,650,000euros sister to Group 1 winner Saffron Beach is in top hands and should be capable of considerably better at some stage.

runners.name: Havana Halo
runners.comment: Fair fifth on both starts; can go well but improvement is needed to beat Woroodd
runners.spotlight: She's been a fair fifth on both starts (7f, good/good to firm) and can give another good account, but improvement is needed to beat Woroodd.

runners.name: Thaisa
runners.breeder: A S Denniff & Makabi Investments Uc
runners.comment: Promise on the first of her two starts towards the end of last year; remains of interest
runners.spotlight: Close third on debut at Kempton (1m, AW) last November; underwhelming there (7f) in December but the subsequent break may have helped and this well-bred filly remains of interest; wears a first-time hood.

2:17.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 2.17 +26yds, 4.17 +28yds and 4.52 & 5.22 +6yds)

runners.name: Fleur De Mer
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs G F Hall Racing
runners.comment: Off 340 days; second run for the yard; new trip and something to prove on firmer than good
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner in 2023 and placed at 1m3f-1m6f in all five subsequent starts for Hugo Palmer, before a modest show for new connections last June; dropped 3lb in her absence but this is a new trip and she has something to prove on firmer than good, having been unraced on it since handicapping.

runners.name: Lunar Power
runners.comment: No solid claims after last 18 months but he is accelerating down the weights and does stay
runners.spotlight: Last won in May 2023, when still in Ireland; no solid claims on what he's done since but he is accelerating down the weights and does stay.

quotes.race: Tipperary Perpetual Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: Lunar Power was very consistent last year on the Flat and over hurdles. He is just a very likeable horse. He bounced back today after a bit of a disappointing run last time. All he does is gallop and stay - Colin Keane, rider.

quotes.race: BetVictor Proud To Support Irish Racing 3yo Hurdle
quotes.quote: Lunar Power got a fright at the first at Down Royal and it got worse from there, but he was not at his best. He was a different horse the last day on the Flat. He jumps well and there is no reason why he can't compete in the good juvenile hurdles - Noel Meade, trainer.

runners.name: The Crafty Mole
runners.comment: Worth this second attempt at 2m and a return to form may well be possible
runners.spotlight: Excelled last April-August at 1m6f, winning five times on varied ground; out of form in his final two starts last term and on 1m4f reappearance one month ago, but a visor (worn on last three starts in 2024) returns and he's worth this second attempt at 2m; return to form may well be possible.

runners.name: Diamand De Vindecy

prev_owners.owner: Nicolas Longere & Ecurie Haras Des Beaux

runners.comment: Unraced on firmer than good; should be strong late on and respected as in-form candidate
runners.spotlight: Registered an emphatic win in five-runner race at Pontefract (2m2f) on reappearance and bang there when third of six at Ripon (2m, again on good) later in April; unraced on firmer than good; should be strong at the finish and respected as an in-form candidate.

runners.name: Simiyann
runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khan's Studs S C
runners.comment: Two AW races (1m6f/2m) last October are his only wins from 26 starts
runners.spotlight: Two AW races (1m6f/2m) last October are his only wins from 26 starts; struggled on turf last season and again in his three runs this year (hurdles, AW and Flat turf) but drops another 3lb, some headgear (absent this year) returns and some stablemates have surged back to winning form recently.

runners.name: Toby Tops
runners.comment: Major progress this spring with three 2m wins, but a muted show at Nottingham on Tuesday
runners.spotlight: Major progress this spring with 2m wins from off the pace at Southwell (AW), Nottingham (good) and Ascot (good to firm); well on top in the latter 13 days ago but produced a muted show in three-runner race at Nottingham on Tuesday.

runners.name: The Craftymaster
runners.owner: S Barton, T Stamp, R Miles, & Partner
runners.comment: Golden spell on the AW between December 2023 and March 2024; plenty to prove at present
runners.spotlight: Seven wins on the AW between December 2023 and March 2024; rather patchy form since, well below form on last three starts, and latest run (his first on turf since summer 2023) reinforced the doubts about him on grass.

quotes.race: BetUK. Home Of The Acca Handicap
quotes.quote: The Craftymaster has been a revelation. He used to be slow, but stayed. Now, when that was going to turn into a sprint, I was thinking you can't go wide as you'll never win, so just wait and see if you outstay them. He's put them to bed in half a furlong with his injection of speed. He's learning and getting better at everything he does. This was the first test of his mettle, a full field with horses who have been in very good form and he's up to it. I don't feel I'm at the bottom of him yet - I feel if something came at him he'd go again -  William Carson, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: The Craftymaster has developed late and we've been very lucky to have him. He's progressing really nicely. He's going up the grades slowly and he's coping with it. He stays very well and he's lazy through his races, so you'd like to think there's always just a tiny little bit left. We'll keep going forward - Tony Carroll, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Razzo Italiano
runners.comment: Three wins over hurdles; four AW Flat races (2m handicap latest) and needs improvement
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over hurdles but Flat career has been just four races on Tapeta, fading into fourth of eight off this mark when upped to 2m last month for Flat handicap debut (disqualified; jockey failed to weigh in); switches to turf and needs improvement.

3:17.race_name: Betfred "Nifty 50" Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Sprint Series Qualifier)
3:17.going_detailed: GOOD TO FIRM, Good in places (GoingStick: 7.6) (Watered) (Rail Movements: 2.17 +26yds, 4.17 +28yds and 4.52 & 5.22 +6yds)

runners.name: March To The Band
runners.comment: Improvement needed but could prove suited by this first crack at sprinting on h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Best run came in the middle of his three starts, when fourth at Dundalk (7f, AW) in December in these cheekpieces (which go back on today); not obviously well treated off this opening mark but he's shown speed and could prove well suited by this first crack at sprinting on handicap debut.

runners.name: Captain Parma
runners.comment: Dam was a useful sprinter; possible the drop in trip will be a positive on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Fair efforts over 1m/7f on AW this spring on his first three starts; his dam was a useful sprinter and it's possible the drop in trip will be a positive on handicap debut; could go well for in-form yard.

runners.name: Coeur Jaune
runners.comment: Shaped over 7f on handicap debut as though today's drop back in trip could be a help
runners.spotlight: Has been unable to recapture the promise of her debut third at Nottingham (5f, good to firm) last June, but last month's fifth on handicap debut at Leicester (7f, good) was a step back in the right direction and she shaped as though today's drop back in trip could be a help; not ruled out.

runners.name: Monomyth
runners.comment: Just 1-13 and inconsistent, but very close 3rd at Windsor recently; might not be far away
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his 13 starts and inconsistent; however, that victory came over 6f at Doncaster last August and he returned to form with a very close third at Windsor (5f, good to firm) recently; might not be far away.

runners.name: City Of Strangers
runners.comment: Easily made all at Redcar in April; disappointing the next twice but not written off
runners.spotlight: Easily made all on handicap debut at Redcar (6f, good to firm) on April 21st; disappointing favourite under a penalty on April 28th and 29th and she's now 10lb higher than for her win, but a 23-day break may have helped and if rediscovering the Redcar form she'll have a major shout.

runners.name: Sundiata Keita
runners.comment: Of interest on maiden form from November, but beaten a long way on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Close third at Newcastle (6f, AW) last November on second start and he's of interest on that form; last month's handicap debut at Ripon (6f, good) came after a break and he may have needed the run, but he was beaten a long way and it's hard to be optimistic after that performance.

runners.name: Thurso
runners.comment: Placed the last twice and a first win could be imminent
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but gelded earlier this spring and has shown improved form to be placed on his two runs since (6f, good to firm/AW); cheekpieces return (no obvious positive impact previously); a win could be imminent.

runners.name: Volendam
runners.comment: Runner-up in 5f/6f maidens at Newcastle and respected on her handicap and turf debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in first-time hood (retained since) at Newcastle (5f, AW) in January on second start and filled same position there (6f) in February; open to further improvement and she's respected on her handicap and turf debut.

runners.name: Kisskodi
runners.comment: Runner-up on handicap/AW debut; down the field back on turf since but not written off
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on handicap/AW debut at Newcastle (6f) in March; down the field at Catterick (6f, good) since and he has something to prove on turf, but he's not written off in view of that promise two starts ago.

runners.name: What What What
runners.comment: Won on Newcastle AW in March but well beaten since when back on grass at Musselburgh
runners.spotlight: Placed over 6f on AW earlier this year and got off the mark in a first-time visor (retained since) at Newcastle (5f, AW) in March; however, well beaten at Musselburgh (5f, good) since and has to prove himself on grass.

runners.name: Trust Sergei
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs S Matheson & Mr S Goodwin
runners.comment: Has won his last two and this progressive colt could still have more to offer
runners.spotlight: Won at Wolverhampton (5f, AW) last month on second handicap start and followed up at Doncaster (6f, good to firm); 4lb rise for last time isn't harsh and this progressive colt could still have more to offer.

runners.name: Bern Rossetti
runners.comment: Kept on for third of five over 5f at Musselburgh on h'cap debut; one to consider now at 6f
runners.spotlight: Slowly away when fair third of five on handicap debut at Musselburgh (5f, good) three weeks ago; kept on nicely and this step back up in trip very much looks the right move; one to consider.

runners.name: Kitty Furnival
runners.comment: Has AW record of 311322 and she's a major player back at the scene of her last win
runners.spotlight: Has AW record of 311322 and she hit another personal best when a clear second behind a subsequent winner on her Lingfield reappearance (1m4f) last month; only 1lb higher here and she's a strong contender back at the scene of her last win.

runners.name: Haku
runners.comment: Last five wins have been over C&D and is well treated if he can revive back at this track
runners.spotlight: Seven-time AW winner and last five have been over C&D; well held at Kempton (1m4f) and Southwell (1m6f) in last two runs but he's now 2lb lower than for his last win in November and has possibilities if he can revive back at this track.

quotes.race: Safer Gambling Tools At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Haku is a legend, he's gone up through the ranks and he always gives his all. He's a favourite in the yard and it's great that he can come and do his job here - Mark Loughnane, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Sax Appeal
runners.breeder: C&s B/S Ltd, C Younghusband, K McGivern
runners.comment: Out of sorts since AW hat-trick in February but has claims if he can get back near best
runners.spotlight: Handy sort who has won five times on AW and the first two legs of his hat-trick in February were over C&D; out of sorts in last two AW runs and was down the field on turf last time, but he now drops back in grade and has claims if he can get back near his best.

runners.name: Isle Of Sark
runners.breeder: Kenneth L Ramsey & Sarah K Ramsey
runners.comment: Overall record of 1-36 and has struggled under both codes for new yard this year
runners.spotlight: Won on his debut at Dundalk (7f, AW) in 2020 but he's 0-35 since and has found things tough over jumps and on the Flat in three runs for three different yards this year; passed over.

stable_tour.quote: We were pleased with his run in the Ballysax, which was his first run on turf, and he will have learned a lot from that. He seems to have come out of that race well and he'll probably go for another Derby trial. 19-04-21

runners.name: Shahbaz
runners.comment: Ended long losing run at Chelmsford but was down the field in follow-up bid at Lingfield
runners.spotlight: Ended a long losing run at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) last month but he couldn't pose threat in his follow-up bid at Lingfield two weeks later; that was a competitive big-field handicap but he needs to step up again after that and he wouldn't want this to be tactical; cheekpieces reapplied.

stable_tour.quote: He progressed as the season went on last year culminating with victory over 1m1f in a Newmarket nursery off a mark of 82. This season he has had two runs, not troubling the judge on either occasion, and he was a bit disappointing last time out at Ascot over 1m2f, where they went no gallop which did not suit him. I am still not convinced he gets 1m2f as if you watch a replay of that race he is weakening as they approach the line. I did put him in the London Gold Cup last Saturday, but it was too dry to run him. I will give him another try over 1m2f and see, but I would not be surprised if we drop him back to a milen. The key to him is the race must be run at proper pace. 28-05-23

9:00.race_name: Race And Rest - Wolverhampton Holiday Inn Fillies' Handicap

runners.name: Sibyl Charm
runners.comment: Placed in each of her three starts since wind surgery; steps back up in trip with claims.
runners.spotlight: Three-time Newcastle winner (6f-7f) with the most recent of those wins coming last March off 14lb higher; has been in the first three in each of her three starts since wind surgery, including here over 6f 16 days ago; 5lb claimer is recruited; steps back up in trip and holds claims.

stable_tour.quote: She did really well for us on the all-weather, then had a break and ran all right at Ayr and Carlisle since she came back. She wants top of the ground and I hope we're in for a dry spell as she has a couple of good options at York. 26-07-24

runners.name: Ornately
runners.comment: Won over C&D in February but failed to back that up at Leicester; back on AW with claims
runners.spotlight: Showed improved form when winning over C&D off 4lb lower in February on handicap debut but she was unable to back that up when switched back to turf at Leicester (7f, good; raced freely) following an 82-day break; worth another chance now returning to AW.

quotes.race: BetMGM: It's Showtime Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: We were quite clear we wanted to get cover on Ornately and it worked out quite nicely. She settled well and David Evans's horse [Piranha Rama] dragged us all the way to the furlong pole. She's done it well - Daniel Muscutt, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Graduated
runners.comment: Encountered a wide trip at Doncaster last time and holds place claims returned to AW.
runners.spotlight: Sole win came in a 7f maiden at Epsom last August; not disgraced at Nottingham (8.5f, good) on return and her most recent effort, when beating only one home at Doncaster (1m, good), is probably worth forgiving given a wide trip; drops back to 7f and holds place claims on her second attempt on AW.

quotes.race: British EBF Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (For horses In Bands C/D) (EBF Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Graduated looks like she's really progressed from her first few runs. Last week at Brighton I didn't think she had an overly hard race against the 1-14 shot Praetorian and we had to play second fiddle to him. We tried to dictate it here and it went well. She's still got the entry [sales race at York] next Thursday and, while we're not guaranteed a run, we'll take a view about it. We'll see how she is after the weekend but it could be a possibility. Seven furlongs is definitely her trip but with the prize-money on offer I wouldn't be opposed to dropping her back in trip for one run and she has a turn of foot - Jamie Insole, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Suzette
runners.comment: Well below form since winning on soft ground at Carlisle last August.
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f soft-ground Class 5 nursery at Carlisle last August off 2lb higher but well below form since, beaten 12l at Beverley last time; tried AW on penultimate start.

runners.name: Maids Head
runners.comment: Fourth here over 6f in the added cheekpieces last time and the return to 7f will suit
runners.spotlight: 0-9 but she's twice finished runner-up over C&D; bounced back from a lesser effort when a close fourth of eight here 16 days ago, keeping on over 6f in first-time cheekpieces and doing best of those held up; will be suited by the return to this trip and commands respect.

runners.name: Blue Empress
runners.comment: Twice placed over C&D since cheekpieces went on; below her best over 6f on turf last time
runners.spotlight: 0-8; placed in her first two outings in cheekpieces (both over C&D) but below her best back on turf over 6f at Yarmouth 30 days ago; has place claims returned to AW with the step back up in trip likely to suit.

runners.name: Little She
runners.comment: Seems to have regressed slightly in novice/maidens; steps back up to 7f on handicap debut.
runners.spotlight: Seems to have regressed slightly in novice/maiden company; steps back up to 7f on handicap debut; watch the market.

runners.name: Enchanted Way
runners.comment: Posted two solid efforts since switched to handicaps; blinkers are back on for cheekpieces
runners.spotlight: 0-7 but she wasn't beaten far when fourth of 12 on handicap debut over C&D in March and backed that up with another solid effort at Southwell last month; the cheekpieces worn for those two starts are replaced by second-time blinkers; place claims once again but may prove vulnerable.

runners.name: Dream Illusion
runners.comment: Posted her best effort when runner-up in a lower grade over C&D last time; competitive
runners.spotlight: Best effort when second of 11 in first-time cheekpieces under Jack Nicholls over C&D this month in her second handicap; steps up in grade but should be competitive.

runners.name: Sheephavenbaystory
runners.comment: Ran well from the front over C&D on her first start for 173 days; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: Best two efforts from five starts have been over this C&D; ran well from the front on handicap debut 16 days ago, weakening late on having raced freely on her first start for 173 days; steps up in grade but she's entitled to come on for that outing and has each-way claims.

runners.name: Dance Recital
runners.comment: Hung badly left in two of her four starts; third here on handicap debut in February.
runners.spotlight: Showed ability at Chelmsford (1m/7f) first two starts but hung badly left in the second of those and proved virtually unrideable here over 6f on her final qualifying run; off since third of eight on handicap debut here (6f) three months ago; up in grade but the step back up in trip should suit.

runners.name: Boubou
runners.comment: Beaten 8l when below-form 4th here on handicap debut over further; more needed from her.
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival on stable/seasonal debut at Kempton (6f, AW) and beaten 8l when below-form fourth of six here on handicap debut over 8.5f; drops back in trip with more needed from her.

6:00.race_name: Visit wolverhampton-racecourse.co.uk To Book Now Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Grace Taufan
runners.comment: Went close on Kempton debut but didn't build on that on return for new yard; tongue-tie on
runners.spotlight: 90,000gns yearling; went close at Kempton (7f, AW; 22-1) in October in sole run for Ismail Mohammed but she failed to build on that on recent stable debut at Newcastle (1m; well-held third); ran well to a point in that race but she has something to find here and needs improvement; tongue-tie on.

runners.name: Miss Justice
runners.comment: Back from a year off with clear second over C&D and she sets a good standard on that form
runners.spotlight: Out of an unraced sister to 1m Group 1 winner Timepiece; promising fourth on Newmarket debut (1m, good) last April and she returned after a year off with a clear second behind a useful rival over C&D three weeks ago; sets a good standard on that form and she's open to more progress; major player.

runners.name: Be Lucky Bear
runners.comment: Has good standard to aim at on debut and yard was 0-14 in maidens last year
runners.spotlight: 14,000euros half-sister to Italian 7f 2yo winner Ludo Of World; dam unplaced 1m2f-1m4f in France, half-sister to winners Blue Canari (French Derby), Blue Ksar (smart 1m-1m2f) and Pekan Star (useful 1m2f); has good standard to aim at on debut and yard was 0-14 in maidens last year.

runners.name: Flightofthephoenix
runners.owner: Old Gold Racing, Tim Cottier & Partner
runners.comment: Went close on Kempton debut and she's open to improvement upped in trip on her return
runners.spotlight: 16-1, made a promising start when head second of 11 in 7f Kempton novice in October, just failing to get up; has quite a bit to find on her return but she should know more this time and is a likely improver upped in trip.

runners.name: Invisible
runners.owner: H R D Mccalmont & H Lascelles
runners.comment: Runner-up twice this spring and has shaped as though this new trip should suit; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival on Southwell debut in December but she's found lots of improvement with her runner-up efforts over 7f at Chelmsford (AW) and Doncaster (good to firm) this spring; has shaped as though this new trip should be within range and she's in the mix for in-form yard.

stable_tour.quote: She was second last time at Doncaster, beaten by a Frankel out of a Cheveley Park winner who cost 1,600,000gns [Alfareqa], so she ran a huge race. Her form is strong from Chelmsford too, as the filly who beat her [Hey Boo] was second in the Fred Darling. The third [Forty Years On] won a Doncaster novice on Lincoln day. I like her and I think she'll get a mile well. She's a good-sized filly and a nice one to follow for the year. I feel a mark of 75 is kind. She'll be out in early June and we'll take it from there. It would be nice to win a couple of races but the ultimate aim would be black type. 14-05-25

runners.name: Kordylia
runners.comment: Still early days but she needs a transformation upped in trip on her return
runners.spotlight: Finished in rear at 14-1 in her two AW runs (7f) in October, with a best RPR of 45; has a good pedigree and it's still early days but she needs a transformation upped in trip on her return.

runners.name: Rajinoora
runners.comment: Didn't live up to market expectations at Newbury and needs to leave that form well behind
runners.spotlight: 78,000gns yearling; heavily backed into 4-1 on Newbury debut (7f, good) last month but she faded into a remote seventh of ten; got a bit worked up before that race and she needs to leave that form a long way behind.

runners.name: Regal Agenda
runners.comment: Has each-way claims on peak form but she's been disappointing in two runs this spring
runners.spotlight: From a good family that has served her owner well; second at Yarmouth (1m, soft) in October makes her one of the top two on form in this line-up, but she's been disappointing in two runs this spring; still unexposed but has something to prove and she needs a major revival back in trip.

runners.name: Rumba Numba
runners.comment: Half-sister to three useful winners but she struggled on recent Yarmouth debut
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to three useful winners but she struggled on her Yarmouth debut (7f, good to firm) three weeks ago and can only be watched after that 18l defeat.

runners.name: Safe Idea
runners.comment: Some promise here towards the end of 2024 but she needs to find more on her return
runners.spotlight: Reached the frame in two runs here (8.6f/9.4f) towards the end of last year but she was beaten 5l when third last time and that form has not really worked out; returns after five months off and needs to raise her game back in trip.

runners.name: Say Again
runners.comment: 240,000gns yearling; stablemate of Miss Justice and market should guide on debut
runners.spotlight: 240,000gns half-sister to winners Strait Of Hormuz (7f-1m3f; RPR 101), Siamsa (Listed-placed 7f 2yo; 92) and Optik (9.4f-1m4f AW; 65); dam placed 7f (55), half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 2 winner Mehmas; stablemate of Miss Justice and has wide draw on debut but she needs watching in market.

runners.name: Silver Chamber
runners.comment: Promise in sole 2yo run but was well held upped to 1m on reappearance; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Shaped with promise when fourth on Newmarket debut (7f, good to soft) in November but she was only seventh of ten on reappearance at Haydock (1m, good) last month; may have needed that run but she has a tough draw on this switch to AW and others are preferred.

8:00.race_name: Get The Inside Track With raceday-ready.com Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Fistral Beach
runners.comment: Three wins in 2025 including over C&D on penultimate run; respected back at this track
runners.spotlight: Has won three of her last five starts including a clearcut success over C&D on her penultimate run; held under penalty at Southwell last time and is 2lb higher here, but she still has scope for further progress and is respected back at this track.

runners.name: Petra Celera
runners.comment: On reduced mark but she needs a major revival back on AW
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped off 8lb lower than for her Southwell win (7f, Tapeta) last August but she's 0-11 since and has form figures of 0860408 this year; has plenty to prove and she needs a major revival back on AW.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Band D) (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Petra Celera is improving. I don't think she does a lot when she hits the front and I'd say a visor may not go amiss - but having said that, if you take the second out she's absolutely bolted up so I'm very pleased and the horses are running well - Karl Burke, trainer.

runners.name: Emerald Army
runners.comment: Win and close third at Thirsk last month and he's open to more progress back on AW
runners.spotlight: Progressive gelding, who won at Southwell (7f, AW) in October and he's reappeared with a win and close third at Thirsk (6f/7f) this spring; nudged up another 1lb but he's still unexposed on AW and is a big player back in this sphere.

runners.name: Classy Clarets
runners.comment: Made his breakthrough over 5f here in December but has struggled since; tongue-tie added
runners.spotlight: Made his breakthrough over 5f here in December but he's not come close to that form since and was tailed off on stable debut at Leicester (6f, good to firm) 12 days ago; that took his record to 1-21 and has lots to prove on this step back up to 7f; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: White Umbrella
runners.comment: Losing run is up to 13 but she's generally reliable and shouldn't be far away
runners.spotlight: Losing run is up to 13 but she's generally reliable and is now 2lb lower than for her win here (6f) last spring; this step back up in trip is no problem and she shouldn't be far away.

quotes.race: Join Our Bet Club At Vickers.Bet Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: White Umbrella relaxed well today and I allowed her to find her feet. She quickened nicely and it was quite a nice performance. She did everything right, but it was only the last half-furlong I thought I'd win. I'm sure she'd get a mile, although I'd be happy to see her over seven next time - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

runners.name: Drafted
runners.comment: Dual Tapeta winner who returned to form with a second over C&D latest; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Both wins have been over 7f on Tapeta and she returned to form with a creditable second over C&D (cheekpieces reapplied) three weeks ago; on unchanged mark and has claims if she can back that up.

runners.name: The Cola Brasil
runners.comment: On dangerous mark and has possibilities if he gets a good pace and some luck
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on his Dundalk win (7f, AW) in October and he's been beaten less than 3l in three runs for new yard this spring (for an inexperienced amateur); can miss the break but he should get a decent tow into this race and could be a big factor back up in trip.

quotes.race: Come Racing To Fairyhouse Next Sunday Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: The Cola Brasil is a big gangly horse that takes a bit of organising. He stayed at it well and won it well. He's in again on Sunday and I might run him - Mick Browne, trainer.

runners.name: Brother Dave
runners.comment: Dual Tapeta winner but he returns after a year off and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Won twice at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) last spring, but he's been absent since a well-held fourth at Newcastle a year ago; bit to prove after a lengthy absence and this is a competitive race.

stable_tour.quote: He's a brother to Bobby Joe Leg, who we call Dave at home and he's a bit of a playboy. He won twice in March of last year, both times over seven furlongs at Southwell. Not long after that he developed a foot problem, which means he hasn't raced since May of last year. I hope he's back in June but I'm not rushing him. You know what they say, ‘No foot, no horse'. 09-04-25

runners.name: Embarked
runners.comment: Plenty of good runs in 2025 but he flopped at Chepstow latest and losing run is up to 18
runners.spotlight: Prominent racer, who has run plenty of good races this year but he flopped at Chepstow (7f, good) last Tuesday and that took his losing run to 18; down the list.

runners.name: Miss Calculation
runners.comment: Some good efforts this year but she's 1-28 on AW and her last turf win was 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: Some good efforts on Tapeta this year but she never got involved over 6f here when last seen in March; goes back up in trip after a break but she's now 1-28 on AW and her last turf win was 12 months ago; others are more persuasive.

7:00.race_name: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Handicap (Div I)

runners.name: Coiled
runners.comment: Struggled in both starts for this trainer (5f-1m) but isn't fully exposed on AW (0-2).
runners.spotlight: Reasonably consistent for Eve Johnson Houghton through the first half of last season, but lost his way prior to moving on for 1,000gns; has struggled in both starts for this trainer (5f-1m), but isn't fully exposed on AW (0-2) and is claimer-ridden from a career-low mark.

runners.name: That Lucas Fella
runners.comment: Little to enthuse about at Musselburgh (1m1f) or Ripon (1m); continues to ease in weights.
runners.spotlight: Gone backwards since finishing fourth at Carlisle (6f novice, soft; 100-1) last September; little to enthuse about this season at Musselburgh (1m1f) or Ripon (1m); continues to ease in the weights for AW return.

runners.name: Beaune
runners.comment: Poor form; gelded prior to debuting for this trainer at Bath (1m; 50-1, last of nine).
runners.spotlight: Ex Irish, 0-4 on the Dundalk Polytrack (7f-1m); was gelded prior to debuting for this trainer at Bath (1m; 50-1) last month, but that yielded no immediate uptick in fortunes, finishing last of nine.

runners.name: Abstract Art
runners.comment: In the shake up over 9.5f here (third, beaten over 4l) in January; one to consider.
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; in the shake up over 9.5f here (third, beaten over 4l) in January, but found stamina reserves overstretched at Kempton (1m4f) four days later, and has been absent since; one to consider in a weak race.

runners.name: Helston Dance
runners.comment: Scarcely managed to beat a rival in three attempts in AW novice/maidens (7f); unlikely.
runners.spotlight: Scarcely managed to beat a rival in three attempts in AW novice/maidens last autumn (all 7f at triple-figure odds); pedigree suggests that this extra yardage could suit and she makes her handicap debut at the lowest level; still unlikely.

runners.name: Bigfield Dreams
runners.owner: Nick Bradley Racing 41 And A Haynes
runners.comment: Toiled in cheekpieces at Redcar (1m) latest; headgear is now tweaked seeking a revival.
runners.spotlight: Offered something when fifth of seven at Southwell (1m; 40-1) on second start, but she's dropped off the radar since, toiling in cheekpieces at Redcar (1m, good to firm) latest; headgear tweaked seeking a revival.

runners.name: Banksman
runners.comment: Switches to AW at realistic level, making more appeal than many of the others; place shout
runners.spotlight: Slightly better since being gelded, keeping on to finish a never dangerous fourth of six at Bath (1m, firm; 18-1) last week; switches to AW at a realistic level, making more appeal than many of the others; place possible.

runners.name: Amber Honey
runners.comment: Shown enough at Redcar & Kempton to suggest she can be competitive; looks the one to beat.
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden; a slow burner, but she's shown enough at Redcar (fifth), and Kempton (third) more recently, to suggest that she can be competitive against this calibre of opposition; the retained blinkers and an easing mark place her at the top of the list.

runners.name: Pacific Man
runners.comment: Last of 12, beaten 30l (200-1), at Newcastle in September; gelded and headgear applied.
runners.spotlight: No promise in three attempts in novice and maiden company, last of 12, beaten 30l (200-1), when last in action at Newcastle in September; gelded with newly applied headgear for this low-level handicap debut; plenty of risks attached.

runners.name: My Candy Girl
runners.comment: Ran freely on stable debut at Brighton (1m2f) just over three weeks ago; needs much more.
runners.spotlight: Failed to get competitive in four starts for Karen Jewell and it was a similar story when returning from a 260-day break at Brighton (1m2f; ran freely on stable debut) just over three weeks ago; only signs of market support would offer encouragement.

5:30.race_name: Download The Raceday Ready App Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Gorgeous Mr George
runners.comment: Failed to progress since upped in trip & switched to handicaps; 2lb lower in cheekpieces.
runners.spotlight: Runner-up to a short odds favourite at Southwell (5f maiden; beaten about 5l) on second start; has failed to progress since upped in trip and switched to handicapping; eases a further 2lb in the weights with cheekpieces now applied; possibilities in a weak race.

runners.name: Woodhay Whisper
runners.comment: Off the mark at 15th attempt at Chelmsford (6f) latest; 2lb higher from the widest draw.
runners.spotlight: Consistent and off the mark at the 15th attempt when justifying favouritism at Chelmsford (6f; with Sarabi third) latest; handles Wolverhampton equally well but a 2lb rise in the weights will make life tougher from the widest draw; key player nevertheless.

runners.name: Sun Keeper
runners.comment: Game C&D win in February; mixed fortunes since, including when refusing to race at Ripon.
runners.spotlight: Wore a first-time tongue-tie when scoring gamely over C&D (from 2lb lower) in February; mixed fortunes since, and it has to a concern that she refused to race at Ripon a fortnight ago; capable if on song but best watched at present.

runners.name: Up The Anti
runners.comment: Posted a low-key comeback in newly applied cheekpieces at Brighton (5.5f) three weeks ago.
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden; ran her best race last year on heavy at Leicester (6f; fourth of 11, 9-1); posted a low-key comeback in newly applied cheekpieces (retained) at Brighton (5.5f) three weeks ago; may strip fitter here; isn't a forlorn hope.

runners.name: Summer Rain
runners.comment: Seven-race maiden; no upturn in fortunes since being gelded; sits on a career-low mark.
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden; no upturn in fortunes since being gelded, and no match for the first two when third over C&D (33-1; beaten approximately 4l) on penultimate start; competes from a career-low mark, and with a 7lb claimer booked.

runners.name: Fancy Dancer
runners.comment: Hasn't shown much (peak RPR 51) in three attempts in maiden/novice company; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: 60,000gns yearling, and a half-sister to the 7f AW winner Tawafag; hasn't shown much - peak RPR 51 - in three attempts in maiden/novice company, latterly when last of eight in a hood (now discarded) at Brighton (6f); can the switch to low-level handicapping provide a spark?

runners.name: Red Vines
runners.comment: Struggled at massive prices in AW maidens (5f-8.5f); gelded prior to this handicap debut.
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a single rival on first two starts, and fared only marginally better when seventh of 12 in a 7f maiden here (300-1) in February; gelded, and off for three months since, but does make handicap debut at an appropriate level.

runners.name: Promise Time
runners.comment: Took a sharp step forward on Southwell (7f) handicap debut, pipped on the post; 6f a plus.
runners.spotlight: Modest form first three starts but took a sharp step forward on Southwell (7f; 22-1) handicap debut, when pipped on the post; dropping to 6f should suit this free-running type, and his trainer has already been in the winners this week.

runners.name: Sarabi
runners.comment: Eight-race maiden; third to Woodhay Whisper at Chelmsford (6f); excuses at Bath since.
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; wasn't far behind Woodhay Whisper at Chelmsford (6f) on penultimate start, but failed to figure at Bath having stumbled leaving the stalls and charted a wide course throughout; others preferred.

8:30.race_name: Get The Inside Track With raceday-ready.com Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Darbucks
runners.comment: Stepped forward from his reappearance when third at Ayr last time; back on AW (0-7).
runners.spotlight: Four-time winner on turf, with the latest win at Redcar (7f, soft) in October off 2lb lower; stepped forward from his reappearance when a 3l fourth of six at Ayr (7f, good to firm) 21 days ago; holds claims if coping with the switch back to AW (0-7).

runners.name: Woodleigh
runners.comment: Well beaten on Tapeta in his last three starts; bit to prove on first start since March
runners.spotlight: Sole win came on soft ground over 6f at Redcar off 6lb higher last May but he's been well beaten on Tapeta in his last three starts; drops in grade with a bit to prove on his first start since March.

runners.name: Triggered
runners.comment: Without a win since October 2023; beaten a neck at Chelmsford last month and has claims.
runners.spotlight: 9yo whose last win came off 15lb higher over C&D in October 2023; beaten a neck off this mark at Chelmsford last month before running below his best at Kempton last time; respected.

quotes.race: Best Racing Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap
quotes.quote: Triggered travelled through the race well and picked up good. We went very quick but he won well in the end - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Capuchinero

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park X, Simon Wood & A Haynes

runners.comment: Below form in her three starts since runner-up over C&D in February; better is needed.
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner who was beaten a neck over C&D in February; below that level in her three starts since and needs better in this switch of headgear.

quotes.race: Book Online At dundalkstadium.com Claiming Race
quotes.quote: Capuchinero is genuine and tough. She has won two now and she is sound and tries. She is a good fun horse for the winter - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: This lovely filly was bred by Chasemore Farm and we managed to get one run into her last autumn when third in a 7f novice at Newmarket, where the form has been boosted by the fourth horse winning twice since. She is training nicely and will definitely get a mile. I hope she will prove a nice filly for owner Andrew Black and I am looking at a median auction maiden at Catterick on April 6. 30-03-22

runners.name: Diligent Henry
runners.comment: C&D winner in April who was third on turf at Doncaster last time; sound claims back here.
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D in early April off 6lb lower and backed that up with a solid effort at Doncaster (7f, good to firm; raced freely); sound claims back here.

runners.name: Bowman
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival home in his two starts for this yard; others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Three-time AW winner who was last successful at Catterick (7f, good) last April off 8lb higher; failed to beat a rival home in his two starts for this stable and off three months since latest; others are preferred.

quotes.race: Cazoo Derby Festival Handicap
quotes.quote: I wanted to get a breather in going down to the road and from there we just stepped up while trying to save a bit for the end. I thought it was a good run and Bowman likes to make the running, but you have to get going on him before they start challenging him as then he can battle back. He had good bits of form before they got him and he ran well last time, so he was not without a chance - William Carson, rider.

quotes.race: Watch Racing TV Novice Auction Stakes
quotes.quote: Bowman was better today and it is nice that he has improved on that first run - Franny Norton, jockey.

runners.name: Autumn Festival
runners.comment: All eight wins on turf but was third on AW at Kempton on his reappearance; each-way chance
runners.spotlight: All eight wins were on turf (latest in 2023) but front-running third of ten at Kempton (1m, AW) on reappearance in April; weakened late on here over 8.5f last time and now drops back to 7f with an each-way chance.

stable_tour.quote: He won seven races for us last year, so it's hard to think he's well handicapped. He'll improve for his comeback and will run himself back into form. He likes to lead. 04-05-23

runners.name: Mudlahhim
runners.comment: Without a win since July 2023; never involved here last time and others are preferred.
runners.spotlight: 9yo who is without a win since July 2023 and he was never involved following a slow start over C&D ten days ago; others have stronger claims.

runners.name: Rebel Redemption
runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival home in his last two starts; off since March and is opposable.
runners.spotlight: A seven-time winner over 6f, with the latest of those coming in August 2022; failed to beat a rival home in his last two outings and he's opposable from out of the weights on his first start since March.

7:30.race_name: Free Digital Racecard At raceday-ready.com Handicap (Div II)

runners.name: Aroof
runners.comment: Hung right and weakened to finish fifth of seven here (1m4f) latest; drops in trip.
runners.spotlight: Five-race maiden; hung right and weakened to finish fifth of seven here (1m4f; 4-1 on first start since a gelding operation) last month; eases in the weights over what is potentially a more suitable trip; foolish to discount in a weak contest.

runners.name: Ignition
runners.comment: Below par when beaten 11-10 fav at Lingfield in February; off for 104-days since; player.
runners.spotlight: Back to his best when fast-finishing third over C&D (first-time blinkers) in February; below par when a beaten 11-10 favourite six days later, but given a break since; entirely possible he can make it ninth-time lucky.

runners.name: Pomme Pomme
runners.comment: Made winning handicap debut at Bath (1m2f, firm) last week; 6lb extra for AW return.
runners.spotlight: Left her previous efforts behind when making a winning handicap debut at Bath (1m2f, firm; 16-1) last week; carries 6lb extra for her AW return, so it will be interesting to see if she can back that up over this slightly shorter trip; on the shortlist.

runners.name: Kilteel
runners.comment: Failed to match best form this year; stamina is unproven beyond a mile; monitor only.
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f nursery at Newcastle last September, and was placed over 6f there the following month; has failed to match those levels in various forms of headgear (now discarded) this year, and has yet to prove her stamina beyond a mile; monitor only.

stable_tour.quote: She's probably not very posh but she's quite a talented filly. She won a nursery at Newcastle last year and then disappointed a little bit, but she's well handicapped. She goes to Chelmsford on Thursday. 30-04-25

runners.name: Scenario
runners.comment: Some improvement when sixth at Chelmsford (6f; 28-1); tackles new trip for handicap debut.
runners.spotlight: Some improvement when sixth on seasonal reappearance at Chelmsford (6f maiden; 28-1); that proved her effectiveness on AW, but she'll have to raise her game further to make her mark on handicap debut over this new trip.

runners.name: Pure Imagination
runners.comment: Not too many positives to be gleaned from her first three appearances; headgear goes on.
runners.spotlight: Not too many positives to be gleaned from her first three appearances (6f-7f novice/maidens, peak RPR 41); switches to handicapping in newly applied headgear, with her pedigree at least suggesting that she'll cope with this extra yardage; others preferred.

runners.name: Benny The Bouncer
runners.comment: Struggled in three runs (7f-1m) for M Attwater; cheekpieces on for handicap/stable debut.
runners.spotlight: Struggled in three runs (7f-1m) for Michael Attwater, and has since changed hands for 1,200gns; cheekpieces seemingly the only reason to hope for better on handicap/stable debut.

runners.name: Invincible Storm
runners.comment: Marked improvement for gelding/wind surgery when runner-up over 7f here (33-1) last month.
runners.spotlight: Marked improvement for gelding operation and wind surgery when runner-up over 7f here (33-1) last month; that form stacks up - winner successful since - but even though he's bred to stay further, he doesn't necessarily look to be crying out for it either; contender.

runners.name: Mighty Real
runners.comment: Gelded and tackles a new trip off a 352-day absence on first start for Hughie Morrison.
runners.spotlight: Didn't convince in three starts (all 5f) for Jack Jones last year; gelded and tackles a new trip off a 352-day absence on first start for Hughie Morrison; tough to know he'll fare, but this is a suitable level to switch to handicapping.

runners.name: Nanna Western
runners.comment: Steps up significantly in trip for AW/handicap debut with plenty to prove; look elsewhere.
runners.spotlight: Didn't manage to beat too many rivals in three attempts on turf (5f-6f; peak RPR 26) last year; steps up significantly in trip for AW/handicap debut with plenty to prove; far safer to look elsewhere for the solution.

5:05.race_name: MC Roofing And Guttering Handicap Chase

runners.name: Aleish Lass
runners.comment: Had been improving but regressed last time on soft ground, this drop in trip is a worry
runners.spotlight: Won maiden point-to-point by 35l in January last year; her next win came in a handicap hurdle at this track two months ago; finished close-up third on her subsequent start; regressed on most recent start but that was on soft ground; drop back in trip is a concern.

runners.name: Miners Bridge
runners.comment: Showed nice level of improvement in hurdling starts and is a player if fit enough
runners.spotlight: Comes with a point-to-point background; showed a nice level of improvement on his hurdling starts to ultimately win a Killarney maiden; ran a nice race on handicap debut when last seen off 16lb higher hurdles mark; 230-day absence; player if fit enough.

runners.name: Midnight Eagle
runners.comment: Didn't build on hurdles win when pulled up last time, may improve with experience
runners.spotlight: Won over hurdles after eight attempts at this track last month; didn't build on that in her first chase start subsequently when pulled up; made a number of errors that day and may improve with experience.

runners.name: Get It Right
runners.comment: Showed improvement to finish third on most recent start, cheek-pieces now tried
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete on first two starts over fences; more like it last time out at Tramore when beaten into third (2m, good to yielding); may be capable of improvement now that cheekpieces are applied.

runners.name: Smallcraftwarning
runners.comment: May be able to build on seventh of 15 on chasing bow ten days ago
runners.spotlight: Seventh of 15 on Killarney chase/stable debut 10 days ago; his solitary win came over hurdles in February at Thurles (16.5f, soft) last year; may be able to build on most recent effort.

runners.name: Crowsatedappletart
runners.comment: Has shown a liking for this track and is running consistently, he is a big player
runners.spotlight: Has shown a liking for this track with 3-4 wins here, including a 2m5f handicap hurdle (good) in October; had success again over hurdles in early December at Cork (yielding) and has run consistently since; has won one handicap chase off a mark of 81 here last May; consistent performer.

runners.name: Baltinglass Hill
runners.comment: Seems to favour hurdling as chase starts have been a little disappointing
runners.spotlight: Three hurdle wins to his name all came on decent ground; seems to favour hurdling as chase starts have been a little disappointing but wasn't at his best last time out over hurdles four weeks ago.

quotes.race: Daily Jackpots At BoyleSports Vegas Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Baltinglass Hill was a very unlucky loser at Navan and it came up soft at Cork last time. Rachael at the last was the difference. He wants good ground. We might run him in a 2m handicap hurdle at Galway because he is tough - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.name: Mister Persistence
runners.comment: Has been well beaten on all starts, hard to see him featuring
runners.spotlight: Has been well beaten on all starts in maiden and handicap hurdles; now tries fences but it is hard to see him playing a part.

runners.name: Rock On Pedro
runners.comment: Ran ok at Wexford last month on return from a break, now with fitness he could be involved
runners.spotlight: A maiden over jumps but ran okay at Wexford last month on return from a break (2m3f, yielding); he is a consistent sort and always runs his race; if he comes on from that run then he could get involved.

runners.name: Glentruan
runners.comment: Finished fifth of ten at Hexham most recently, others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: His best performance in recent times came at Listowel in September when finishing a respectable fifth of 16 (2m3f, soft to heavy); beaten by large margins on his four starts since; most recently finished fifth of ten at Hexham; both wins have come over hurdles; others appeal more.

quotes.race: corkracecourse.ie Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Glentruan ran in a good race the last day, is a lovely horse and hopefully he will make a lovely chaser. There's a lovely syndicate involved with him, so hopefully they'll have a bit of fun with him - Paddy Neville, trainer.

runners.name: Be My Hero
runners.breeder: R O'Brien Snr,R O'Brien Jnr & L O'Brien
runners.comment: Ran respectably on most recent start and he could play a role if fences improve him
runners.spotlight: Ran respectably over hurdles when returning from a big layoff on most recent start, travelling okay but made a bad mistake at a crucial point; prior to that his form was mediocre; he could play a role if his first run over fences brings about some further improvement.

runners.name: Added Bonus
runners.comment: Last win came last year off the same mark he runs from today, can't be totally discounted
runners.spotlight: Beaten a distance at Tipperary on most recent start; last win came last year off current mark; he can't be completely discounted but others are preferred.

runners.name: Dontdooddson
runners.breeder: M Goulven, Mlle Celine, M Pierre-Yves Berthouloux & Mme Fa
runners.owner: Profit In Your Pocket Racing Club
runners.comment: Veteran of the field and the handicapper continues to drop him but he is hard to fancy
runners.spotlight: The veteran of the field and hasn't had a win for three years; his most recent third over hurdles at Tramore was his best effort for a while; prior to that he finished 42l behind in a handicap chase; the handicapper continues to drop him but he is hard to fancy.

runners.name: The Eye Of Tulla
runners.comment: Two chase wins came in 2023 but badly out of form since then
runners.spotlight: Two chase wins came in 2023 but has been badly out of form since; he runs from a 7lb lower mark since his last win but his two runs since he had a break didn't set the world alight.

runners.name: Ardad Derek
runners.comment: Has shown little in ten starts and is unlikely to be involved
runners.spotlight: Has shown little in ten starts; returned from an absence at the start of the month with a middling effort; unlikely to be involved.

runners.name: Surviving Murmansk
runners.comment: Dual-purpose maiden but has been dropping in the weights, now makes debut over fences
runners.spotlight: Maiden on Flat and over hurdles; beaten by 5l on hurdling debut in 2023 from a 13lb higher mark but his efforts since that have been disappointing; showed some flickers of life last time out at Tramore when staying on into fourth.

runners.name: Max Time
runners.comment: Has shown little in five starts since sole hurdle success last year, chase debut; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; solitary win came at Galway back in September over hurdles (2m7f, gd-yld); has shown little on his five starts since that success; makes chasing debut.

runners.name: Katzoff
runners.comment: 38-race maiden and poor efforts over fences; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; 38-race maiden including 16 runs over hurdles; his best performance came last July when finishing second in a 2m1f handicap hurdle; his efforts over fences have not been at that level; 1lb wrong.

runners.name: Fly De Megaudais
runners.breeder: E A R L De Megaudais
runners.comment: Last win came two years ago and his recent form is not overly encouraging; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; last win came two years ago and his recent form is not overly encouraging; 4lbs wrong.

quotes.race: Jim Ryan Racecourse Services Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Fly De Megaudais jumped great and it was straightforward. He wants further but the ground suited him well - Cian Quirke, rider.

5:38.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Chase

runners.name: A Law Of Her Own
runners.comment: Highly tried over fences, needs things to fall into place for her if she is going to win
runners.spotlight: Highly tried over fences and winning just once; beat a subsequent 10l winner of a Cheltenham handicap when winning her beginners' chase under positive tactics; less impressive last time out in a handicap chase; she needs things to fall into place for her if she is going to win.

quotes.race: Munster INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: A Law Of Her Own has been very consistent from day one and has improved away. I knew I was turning her back out quickly but the way she travels in her races, I wanted to come here and we got away with it. She battled hard and I think she will be a lot better over hurdles - Peter Fahey, trainer.

runners.name: Je Tai Porte
runners.comment: This is more her level after being faced with some daunting tasks, she is a live contender
runners.spotlight: Has been running in some hot contests including the Grade 2 mares' chase at Cheltenham when sent off at 100-1; her penultimate run at Cork when finishing third in a handicap chase was pleasing; this is more her level and she is a live contender.

quotes.race: KOG Logistics Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: I've tried to sit Je T'ai Porte in a couple of times but she'd be fairly free and doing a bit too much the whole time, but she was grand in front here. I think the loose horse from the last helped her, she put in a good round of jumping and hopefully could win more - Shane Fitzgerald, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Tote Always SP Or Better Guaranteed Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Je T'ai Porte is not the most straightforward. I'm hoping when she steps up in class she might improve as she might be able to take a lead. She will stay going for the summer - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

stable_tour.quote: She had a great summer, winning twice over fences. We've given her a break and she'll be back for the spring. 12-11-24
She had a great summer, winning twice over fences. We've given her a break and she'll be back for the spring. 13-11-24

runners.name: Look To The West
runners.comment: Impressive winner last time out and a repeat of that will likely be sufficient
runners.spotlight: An impressive winner of a Kilbeggan beginners' at the second time of asking last time out and beating a decent yardstick into second in the process; she showed a tendency to race a little freely on her chase debut but a repeat of her latest performance will likely suffice.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Look To The West had some lovely runs over hurdles so it was great to do that over fences, her jumping was very good. She's very straightforward, loves her jumping and is an easy ride - Rachael Blackmore, jockey, speaking to Racing TV

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Look To The West came to me well recommended. She had been working well and we hoped she would do something like that. She gallops and jumps - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She had a couple of good runs last season and will go over fences this term. She had the class to win over two miles last season but I'd like to think she'll be effective over three. We'll look to get her out in the next three to four weeks. 18-11-24

runners.name: Justabitofyours
runners.comment: Her form would make her an unlikely winner here
runners.spotlight: Beaten a distance when sent off at 80-1 in Killarney beginners' last time; her previous form would also make her an unlikely winner here.

6:08.race_name: Summer Racing @ Limerick Racecourse Beginners Chase

runners.name: Ambitious Fellow
runners.comment: Has not shown himself to be a natural in previous five runs over fences
runners.spotlight: Has been out of form in recent times; has not shown himself to be natural jumper; his five runs over fences have seen him fall twice; his other runs in this sphere have not convinced either.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Handicap Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Ambitious Fellow lost his form and there was an issue with him after he ran at Limerick last year, but he looks back to himself now. I was worried about the ground but it worked out great - Peter Fahey, trainer.

quotes.race: Allman Contracts Novice Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ambitious Fellow has great form and he was unlucky [when brought down] at the Galway festival, with the rain also coming. He's a novice for this season in the UK because of the timing of his Punchestown win. He has plenty of experience and the trip of two miles and five furlongs at Cheltenham in November would suit him. Once the ground goes soft he'll get a break - Peter Fahey, trainer

quotes.race: Connolly's RED MILLS Irish EBF Auction Hurdle Series Final
quotes.quote: Ambitious Fellow was bought to be sold but we brought him across to Doncaster and couldn't get anyone to buy him - Peter Fahey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: The ground was just far too soft for him at Wetherby and, with the benefit of hindsight, I probably shouldn't have run him. I've an eye on the big three mile handicap hurdle at Navan worth €100,000 next month if the ground isn't too soft. We're really looking forward to sending him over fences next season. 27-11-23

I thought he was impressive in winning his bumper at Fairyhouse. He was bought to be sold and we brought him to the sales after Fairyhouse but we weren't getting enough for him so we brought him home. In hindsight he should never have run over hurdles at Clonmel last month as it was a bit soon after being over at the sales. He didn't jump great that day but he jumps well at home and the plan is to get a run or two into him before the auction series final at Punchestown in the spring. 08-12-21

runners.name: Encanto Bruno
runners.comment: Form has tailed off since last win in 2023, he needs a revival
runners.spotlight: Bumper and hurdles winner; rated 139 over hurdles; has shown little in five starts since last winning a novice hurdle at Cheltenham in October 2023; lost his action on beginners' chase debut when pulled up last October; returned last month and was beaten 20l into second; he has the ability but he needs a revival.

quotes.race: Trustatrader Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Encanto Bruno was keen quite early and jumped a few big but travelled very strongly. He surprised me to be honest, although he goes well at home he's a far better racehorse than he is work horse. He's versatile, he could come back to two (miles) and he's a lovely horse to look forward to and he'll be exciting when he jumps a fence - Gavin Cromwell, trainer.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Price Boosts All Channels Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The plan is Cheltenham later on this year and I think Encanto Bruno will stay well - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Spirax-Sarco Engineering Sustainability Open National Hunt Flat Race (Category 1 Elimination) (GBB)
quotes.quote: This is an important one as we thought Encanto Bruno was very good. He's done everything right at home along the way and the race wouldn't have been run to suit with a slow pace all the way. He's a baby and he was spooking at the screen going out and coming back in but he looks a proper horse. He's only a 4yo so I'd say we'll probably leave him in bumpers because there's a whole life ahead of him. He hasn't had much of a break since we've got him so we'll probably give him a holiday now and come back in the spring for a nice race. He's going to be a nice jumper in time - John McConnell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won a novice hurdle nicely at Cheltenham last month. He travelled strongly over two and a half miles there, nearly a bit too strong, and overjumped a few. He looks versatile as he could definitely come back in trip. I'm not sure he's as ground-dependent as people think, so we might try him on soft ground and see how he gets on - I wouldn't rule out going for the Royal Bond as I think he can make his mark in Graded races. He jumps very well and is one to look forward to when we send him over fences. 10-11-23

We got him after he won his point-to-point at Ballynoe 12 months ago and he has done himself proud. We took him to Cork for his first run in a bumper and he won that, but he was even more impressive when a good four-length winner at Cheltenham in November. We sent him back for the festival but the soft ground blunted his speed. He's a possibility for Aintree or Punchestown and then we may go hurdling in the summer with him. He jumps well and looks a nice hurdling prospect. 06-04-23

runners.name: Intellotto
