runners.comment: Has some nice form on the Flat and over hurdles, may have enough to take this on chase bow
runners.spotlight: Returned from 240-day break when finishing 0.75l behind Jigoro last month; ran some nice races in a Flat campaign last summer; 2-5 over hurdles and has run in two Grade 1s in that sphere; if he takes to chasing at the first attempt, he may have enough to take this.

quotes.race: Hazel Wood Maiden
quotes.quote: It was fairly plain sailing for Intellotto today. I just let him bowl away and he stayed at it good. He was only just doing what he needed to. He did roll around a little bit up the straight but, kept up to his work, he stuck his head out and got through the line well - Dylan Browne McMonagle, jockey.

quotes.race: Panoramic Restaurant At Limerick Racecourse Hurdle
quotes.quote: Intellotto has been well placed by Joseph and this was a nice opportunity. He is a progressive horse and on better ground he could do well at the spring festivals - Daryl Jacob, rider.

quotes.race: Paddy Power I Have No Idea What Day It Is 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Intellotto had a lovely run at Cork earlier in the year then had a setback, he missed the summer which was probably a blessing in disguise in hindsight. Simon (Munir) and Isaac (Souede) were happy to wait with him and come here, I thought it was a very nice debut and Daryl (Jacob) said he was pleased with him, he learned on the job but finished off the race strong. The logical move would be to come back here for the Dublin Racing Festival - Joseph O'Brien, trainer, talking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He'll start off in a juvenile hurdle next month and we'll take it from there. His form on the Flat looks nice and he's a fine, big horse. So far his schooling has gone well. 27-11-23

runners.name: Jigoro
runners.comment: Disappointing on only previous try over fences but is generally consistent over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Finished 0.75l in front of Intellotto when second over hurdles at Cork last month; beaten on Thurles chase debut in November despite being sent off at odds of 4-9; showed a tendency to jump left on that occasion; chance if he can translate hurdles form to chasing.

quotes.race: Mervyn Gray Construction Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was a good performance from Jigoro and we knew he had improved plenty from the first day. Obviously there was a lot of talk about Tom Cooper's horse and I thought it was a good performance. Jack was delighted with him and said he'll stay further. He said a faster gallop would have suited him but he was very happy with the run. He could go for the four-year-old hurdle at Limerick over Christmas - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: His form tailed off a bit in the spring, but he had put up some decent performances before that. He's going novice chasing and could be a dark horse . He's better than you've seen so far. 28-10-24

runners.name: Minella Sergeant
runners.comment: Beaten by large margins on all starts and hard to envision him winning
runners.spotlight: Beaten by large margins on all point and bumper starts; first run for new trainer here having switched from Emmet Mullins; hard to envision him winning.

runners.name: Star In The Park
runners.comment: Tries fences for the first time but his hurdles form does not provide much encouragement
runners.spotlight: Tries fences for the first time but his hurdles form does not provide much encouragement.

runners.name: I A Connect
runners.comment: Struggled over the cross-country course at Punchestown on latest; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Ex-Gordon Elliott; four-time winner; modest form since Tipperary win in 2023; struggled over the cross-country course at Punchestown on latest; others preferred on this occasion.

quotes.race: equuip - A Leg Up For Thoroughbred People Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: I A Connect pecked a bit at the back of second-last but he stays and probably wants further than that. I sent him on early as all he does is stay and to be fair to him he stuck his head out and battled - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: William Hill Ireland Best Odds Guaranteed Hurdle
quotes.quote: I A Connect picked up again when the other horse came to him. He will be better over 2m4f - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was running a big race at Punchestown in a hot handicap hurdle when he got rid of Adrian Heskin at the second-last. There could be a nice race in him this season off his mark in the low 130s. 18-10-22

runners.name: Clonshire River
runners.comment: Soundly beaten in four chase starts; the step up in trip needs to help
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner in 2021; runner-up three times in maiden hurdles; soundly beaten in four chase starts; the step up in trip needs to bring about improvement.

runners.name: Ahead Of The Posse
runners.comment: Never-nearer third off this mark at Downpatrick (2m2f, good) last August; has a chance
runners.spotlight: Has useful chase experience, including when a never-nearer third off this mark at Downpatrick (2m2f, good) last August; ran okay over hurdles after an absence at Ballinrobe last month; enters the discussion.

runners.name: Garde La Peche
runners.breeder: M David Powell, Mme Anna Bromley, S C E A De La Perrigne & M
runners.comment: Slowly coming back to the boil with staying-on fourth at Kilbeggan last month; player
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; ran well in couple of maiden hurdles before successful chasing debut at Clonmel (2m4f, good) last June; picked up an injury at Tramore in August; slowly coming back to the boil with staying-on fourth at Kilbeggan last month; player.

runners.name: West Clare
runners.comment: Listowel winner may have his work cut out from 7lb higher on chase debut on quicker ground
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in a point-to-point; gained first hurdles win in Listowel handicap in September (2m6f, soft) and has been off since; may have his work cut out from 7lb higher on chase debut on quicker ground.

runners.name: Carlas Big Jim
runners.comment: Runner-up in C&D handicap chase in March; struggled since; best form on testing ground
runners.spotlight: Dual-winning hurdler is 0-5 chasing; course form figures read as 2252, including when distant runner-up of six in novice handicap chase over C&D in March off 96; has struggled since; best form on testing ground.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Money Back On Every Race At Cheltenham Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Carlas Big Jim probably got an easy lead, but he acts well on that ground. Cal knows him very well and he says he jumps better when he's up there. We might run him next in a qualifier for the Full Circle Series at Cork - Louis Archdeacon, trainer.

runners.name: Gustavo Goodway
runners.owner: T Leopold, P Smith, D P Connolly & C Connolly
runners.comment: Races from 4lb higher back chasing but rider's claim should prove valuable; big chance
runners.spotlight: Finally broke his duck over hurdles at Down Royal (2m6f, good) last month when coming from rear to win in a stylish manner; races from 4lb higher back chasing but rider's claim should prove valuable; big chance.

runners.name: U Asking Me
runners.comment: In decent form over hurdles; point winner is respected on chase bow but might need the run
runners.spotlight: Impressive winner over hurdles at Clonmel (2m4f, good) off 80 in October before finishing second at Fairyhouse next time; two decent runs subsequently; point-to-point winner is respected on chase bow but might need the run.

runners.name: Aspurofthemoment
runners.comment: Dromahane point winner; 2-2 over hurdles for this yard; player on chasing debut
runners.spotlight: Bought for 25,000euros after winning Dromahane point-to-point in November; off the mark on first start over hurdles for this yard at Gowran in January (2m, soft to heavy); followed up easily from 11lb higher at Bellewstown (3m, good); chasing debut.

runners.name: Boston Rover
runners.comment: Maiden hurdler hails from top yard and could improve for switch to chasing
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-5 over hurdles; kept on into third without threatening in 2m4f Navan handicap hurdle when last seen in December; hails from top yard and could improve for switch to chasing.

runners.name: Iceberg Theory
runners.comment: 120-rated hurdler was eyecatching second on chase debut at Wexford on latest; considered
runners.spotlight: Winner of maiden hurdle at Navan (2m4f, heavy); some creditable handicap efforts in that sphere; 120-rated hurdler was an eyecatching second on chase debut at Wexford (25.5f, good to yielding) on latest; considered.

quotes.race: Wesco Electrical Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: We put cheekpieces on Iceberg Theory today as we were worried the last day that he might be a bit of a devil, so we put them on today to make him concentrate. We were a bit worried with the way he was carrying on here in the parade ring, but Sean said he was only acting the maggot. He did it well and maybe we'll give him a stab at the auction final in Punchestown - Paul Nolan, trainer.

runners.name: Mister Beeton
runners.comment: Good run behind subsequent dual Grade 1 winner Croke Park in Fairyhouse beginners' in Nov'
runners.spotlight: On a losing run since Punchestown success over hurdles (23.5f) in June 2023; wasn't disgraced behind subsequent dual Grade 1 winner Croke Park in Fairyhouse beginners' in November; tailed off in Punchestown handicap hurdle last month.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Play "1-2-Free" On Football Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mister Beeton was only going through the motions turning in and once he got the gap I was confident enough. He won well in the end - Shane Nolan, trainer.

runners.name: Work Place
runners.comment: Tailed off behind Born Bright in Thurles handicap hurdle in March; 0-3 in point-to-points
runners.spotlight: Tailed off behind Born Bright in Thurles handicap hurdle in March; 0-3 in point-to-points; hard to fancy on chase debut.

runners.name: Born Bright
runners.comment: Looked in need of further when 7th of 13 at Kilbeggan (20.5f) on chase debut six days ago
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; stayed well when winning Thurles handicap hurdle (2m6f, good) in March; looked in need of further when seventh of 13 at Kilbeggan (20.5f) on chase debut six days ago; bit to find.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: That's fantastic and I'm delighted with Born Bright. She won a point-to-point and my son got to ride her in a few bumpers but she wants good ground and it went soft in Sligo and Listowel. This was a race that really suited and it was local. She'll run away over hurdles now - Claire O'Connell, trainer.

runners.name: Cobra Queen
runners.comment: Point winner; enjoys good ground; two hurdle wins; chase debut for yard in form
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; two handicap hurdle wins on good ground last summer at Cork and Ballinrobe; never on terms in pair of competitive handicap hurdles of late; chase debut for stable in good form.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Instagram Mares Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cobra Queen was a bit unlucky when she fell the last day but jumped well today and travelled well. She did it nicely - Rachael Blackmore, rider.

runners.name: Grooveykindoflove
runners.breeder: M Gilles Defontaine & M Frederic Duvivier
runners.comment: Below best in Thurles novice when last seen; strikes as type who will flourish over fences
runners.spotlight: Gained compensation for two narrow defeats when landing Thurles maiden hurdle in November (2m7f, good) against her own sex; that form has worked out well; below best in novice there when last seen but strikes as the type who will flourish over fences now.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was ideal that someone made the running as I didn't feel Grooveykindoflove was the most natural front-runner at Roscommon. She jumped really well and picked up well to the line and had no problem staying. She gave me a total different feel today compared to Roscommon when we went slow and she maybe got tapped for a little toe - Darragh O'Keeffe, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Cloughroe
runners.comment: Improved on handicap chase bow when beaten a neck at Killarney; up 3lb but can go well
runners.spotlight: Maiden is 0-4 in chases; well beaten first three starts in this sphere but improved on handicap chase debut when beaten a neck at Killarney (20.5f, yielding) 10 days ago; up 3lb but entitled to go well again.

runners.name: Person Of Interest
runners.owner: Anthony N Durkan & B M Durkan
runners.comment: Runner-up on chase debut at Downpatrick; pair pulled well clear; extra trip will suit
runners.spotlight: Improved on first start for Shark Hanlon when runner-up on chase debut at Downpatrick (19.5f, good) off 2lb lower; they pulled well clear and he should relish the extra distance here.

runners.name: Island Mccoo
runners.comment: Surprise Tramore winner was arguably very unlucky in follow-up bid on latest; chance
runners.spotlight: Surprise winner at Tramore (2m6f, yielding) last month off 89; better than bare result at Kilbeggan on latest when pecked on landing and almost unseated when making good headway; not ruled out.

runners.name: Meehall
runners.comment: Pulled up off career-high hurdles mark at Fairyhouse in January; capable of bouncing back
runners.spotlight: Hit form approaching the start of autumn last year, winning over fences at Killarney and hurdles at Galway; pulled up off career-high hurdles mark at Fairyhouse in January; capable of bouncing back.

quotes.race: COLM QUINN BMW Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Meehall likes the track, the trip and gets through that softer ground. He is very versatile, that's his second win of the summer and we'll look for something similar over either fences or hurdles in the next few weeks - Conor McNamara, assistant trainer

quotes.race: COLM QUINN BMW Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Meehall got a lovely ride from Conor, he kept it simple and was nice and handy the whole way. He kept him to the best of the ground. He jumped well. He has come of age a little. He has been running away during the summer and we will give him a chance now - Eric McNamara, trainer.

quotes.race: Owens McCarthy Claims Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Meehall was straightforward out in front and galloped all the way to the line. He got in tight to the last two fences but was clever out over them - Cathal Landers, rider.

runners.name: Ixigreczed
runners.breeder: S C E A De Maulepaire
runners.comment: Well-backed when disappointing in handicap hurdle here on latest; the jury is out
runners.spotlight: Won Kilbeggan handicap hurdle (2m3f, good to yielding) last summer under 5lb claimer; ran well for long way on second chase start when sixth at Clonmel; well-backed when disappointing in handicap hurdle here on latest; the jury is out.

runners.name: Stellar Symphony
runners.comment: Both hurdle wins on good; beaten a neck over hurdles at Cork 12 days ago; don't rule out
runners.spotlight: Both hurdle wins have been at 3m on decent ground, including at Clonmel last October; belatedly tried over fences when midfield at Wexford last month; beaten a neck over hurdles at Cork (24.5f) 12 days ago; don't rule out.

runners.name: Tullyhogue Fort
runners.comment: Finished third in 19.5f handicap chase on this card last year off 95 but poor form overall
runners.spotlight: Finished third in 19.5f handicap chase on this card last year off 95; last won over fences at Tipperary in July 2023; has largely struggled for form of late; others preferred.

quotes.race: Guinness Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Tullyhogue Fort is a bit of a learning job. He's been sick for a while since he won at Galway last year. He's always run well there. We kind of minded him there the last day as the ground was too soft but he ran through the line. I think he's better now taking his time. He learns a bit more about racing. It was great to win. He's an honest horse - Paul O'Neill, jockey.

runners.name: Nazine
runners.comment: Strike-rate of 1-21 over hurdles, with that win in 2021; has shown ability over fences
runners.spotlight: Modest strike-rate of 1-21 over hurdles, with that win in 2021; has shown ability over fences but needs to bounce back from tame hurdles efforts.

runners.name: Zolpharine
runners.comment: Respectable hurdles run at Kilbeggan last week but has modest chase form; risky
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner at Kilbeggan (2m, good to yielding) in 2023; respectable hurdles run at that same venue last week but has modest chase form; risky.

runners.name: Tippin And Tappin
runners.comment: Well beaten in eight starts under rules but comfortably won Stowlin point 18 days ago
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in eight starts under rules but comfortably won Stowlin point-to-point 18 days ago; market will reveal expectations here.

runners.name: Bondi Boy Blue
runners.comment: Good third at Sligo in October; not as good next time; jumping needs to improve
runners.spotlight: Patchy form over hurdles but improved on his chase debut when close third at Sligo (3m2f, good) off this mark in October; not as good at Punchestown next time; chance if the jumping brushes up a bit.

runners.name: Kadys Dirha
runners.comment: Had three runner-up finishes in handicap chases last summer; each-way contender
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-25 under rules but is a better chaser; backed from 50-1 into 10-1 before the off when fifth in 3m1f Tipperary maiden hurdle eight days ago; had three runner-up finishes in handicap chases last summer; each-way contender.

runners.name: Arthor
runners.comment: Fell at the sixth when sent off joint-favourite at Tramore on latest; not dismissed
runners.spotlight: Modest 21-race maiden under rules; won point-to-point in January; ran okay in Wexford handicap chase last month; fell at the sixth when sent off joint-favourite at Tramore nine days later; not dismissed.

runners.name: God Help Us
runners.comment: Had fair hurdles form a long time ago but has shown little this year; cheekpieces tried
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in hunter chase after winning point-to-point last year; had fair hurdles form a long time ago but has shown little this year; cheekpieces tried now.

runners.name: Great Rainbow
runners.breeder: E A R L Haras Du Camp Benard
runners.comment: Record of 0-10 over hurdles; of interest if the market vibes are strong on chase debut
runners.spotlight: Record of 0-10 over hurdles, best effort when third of 16 at Punchestown (20.5f, good to yielding) last May; off since October; would be of interest if the market vibes are strong on chase debut.

runners.name: Kalnoo
runners.comment: Some creditable efforts in defeat over hurdles this year; champion conditional booked
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; 20-race maiden under rules; some creditable efforts in defeat over hurdles this year; champion conditional booked for the ride.

runners.name: Pride Of Place
runners.comment: Watch the betting on handicap chase debut if he gets a run; cheekpieces; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; set some stiff tasks in three chases to date; watch the betting on handicap chase debut if he gets a run; cheekpieces.

runners.name: Hit The Frame
runners.comment: Some ability in points but beaten out of sight on chase debut at Downpatrick; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; showed some ability in points but beaten out of sight on chase debut at Downpatrick.

runners.name: Milan Dollar Lady
runners.comment: 0-2 in points; never threatened in seven starts under rules; passed over; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; 0-2 in points; never threatened in seven starts under rules; passed over.

runners.name: Sam Magee
runners.comment: Fairyhouse winner ran well in good Leopardstown handicap after; big player in this
runners.spotlight: Went up 8lb for beating subsequent hurdles winner St Denis's Well at Fairyhouse (21.5f, yielding) in November; jumping issues when fifth of 17 to Sequestered (runner-up at DRF since) at Leopardstown in December; sets a good standard.

quotes.race: Race And Stay Ladies Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Sam Magee was a bit disappointing during the summer. He stays well and likes a bit of nice ground - Henry de Bromhead, trainer

runners.name: Antrim Coast
runners.comment: Poor favourite in 2m4f Fairyhouse novice last month; surely capable of better up in trip
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdles winner has won at 3m; been way below that level in four chase runs, including when a disappointing favourite in 2m4f Fairyhouse novice last month; surely capable of better up in trip on handicap debut.

stable_tour.quote: He won his maiden hurdle well at Punchestown before a good third back at that track in the spring and won over three miles at Wexford in May, but he had a setback after that. He's back cantering now but you won't see him until after Christmas. 12-11-24

He won his maiden hurdle well at Punchestown before a good third back there in the spring and won over three miles at Wexford in May, but he had a setback after that. He's back cantering now but you won't see him until after Christmas. 13-11-24

runners.name: The Gradual Slope
runners.comment: Bit better when fifth in Killarney National 11 days ago; would want the ground to soften
runners.spotlight: Won nice pot at Punchestown (31.5f, soft) last May off this mark; beaten 37l in the same race off 117 on penultimate run; little bit better when fifth in Killarney National 11 days ago but would want the ground to soften.

quotes.race: Colm Quinn BMW Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Mark [McDonagh, jockey] gave The Gradual Slope a cool ride the whole way round, he just got him to switch off halfway down the back because he was over-travelling. It was a great way for him to lose his claim. This fellow has been really running well in beginners' chases where you meet the top novices off level weights. He's only small, but coming in here off a nice weight he had a big chance - Sean O'Brien, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: The Gradual Slope did that very well. We kept it simple. He's probably not the quickest horse and riding him handy here made all the difference. He's versatile and perhaps we will got for a novice handicap down the line - Sean O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Ceroc
runners.comment: Needed the run when well beaten in Tipperary beginners', wanting a much stiffer test
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdles winner has hit the frame in three of his five chase starts; needed the run after an absence when well beaten in Tipperary beginners' two weeks ago, wanting a much stiffer test; should leave that run behind up in trip.

quotes.race: Support The Irish Injured Jockeys Fund Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ceroc got confidence from Cork and he jumps very well. Around a tighter track I was happier it was three miles rather than two-and-a-half - Philip Enright, rider

quotes.race: Follow Us On Twitter Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Ceroc has been disappointing but he seemed to get his mojo back. He lost his way a little bit but we always thought he was a nice horse - Edward O'Grady, trainer.

runners.name: Friends N Commerce
runners.comment: Would have a chance judged on runner-up finish at Thurles over a year ago; watch market
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 22 starts; would have a chance judged on runner-up finish at Thurles (20.5f, heavy) off this mark in March of last year; best form on testing; respectable eighth of 14 in Cork handicap hurdle after over a year off 12 days ago; watch the betting.

runners.name: Fairyhill Run
runners.comment: Five-time winner on a losing run since 2021; course winner but others preferred
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner on a losing run since 2021; modest efforts over fences since returning from lengthy absence in March; course winner but others preferred.

quotes.race: Newcastlewest Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Fairyhill Run is real good mare and she'll go straight for the Blazers at Galway next. She's high class - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Ballykisteen Hurdle
quotes.quote: Fairyhill Run is a savage mare. She might go back over fences and I think she will win a good mares' chase - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Patrickswell Beginners Chase
quotes.quote: Fairyhill Run is a lovely mare and she will be way better over fences. She's a lovely scopey mare. She's a fast jumper and a real galloper, we will keep her to novice company for now - John Ryan, trainer.

quotes.race: Bluegrass Horse Feed Novice Hurdle (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: I think The Little Yank might have won if he wasn't hampered and Fairyhill Run ran a cracker. She's a talented mare and will stay to pattern races. The Little Yank is coming back to where he was last year - John Ryan, trainer of Fairyhill Run and The Little Yank

quotes.race: McHale Fusion 3 Range Mares Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: She's a nice mare, a winter type. She's just a galloper and was big and weak last year. I had a very good mare in Mystery Stowaway that I lost recently and this one has the potential to be another - John Ryan, trainer of Fairyhill Run

runners.name: Priory Park
runners.comment: Four-time point winner was an eyecatcher at Killarney 10 days ago; should relish this trip
runners.spotlight: Dual-winning hurdler; 0-13 over fences but four-time point-to-point winner was an eyecatcher when sixth of 15 at Killarney (20.5f, yielding) 10 days ago, beaten 8.75l; should relish the step up to this trip.

quotes.race: Irish Daily Star Christmas Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Mark said they went a very moderate gallop and I was very worried with the last hurdle being missed because jumping is his forte but you'd have to say Priory Park did it quite nicely. He'll go up a little bit in trip - Edward O'Grady, trainer.

quotes.race: ThurlesRaces.ie Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Priory Park will go for something similar next and will make a nice chaser, perhaps later in the season. He's a nice horse - Edward O'Grady, trainer.

runners.name: Emily In Paris
runners.comment: Jumping issues when outclassed in Kilbeggan beginners' on latest; this is more realistic
runners.spotlight: Beaten 9l when runner-up in Clonmel handicap (2m7f, good to yielding) off 97 in March on her first start since November; jumping issues present when outclassed in Kilbeggan beginners' on latest; this is a more realistic opportunity; tongue-tied.

quotes.race: Lighthouse At Clifford Electrical Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Emily In Paris was well in this evening. She's not a bad filly and she's out of a mare who won over a mile-and-a-half on the Flat - Davy Fitzgerald, trainer

quotes.race: Prix Bertrand du Breuil Longines (Group 3) (3yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: One mile most certainly is Marhaba Ya Sanafi's  best trip, so it was not a surprise to see him win again today. His owner is keen to see him run again this season in the Prix Jacques Le Marois so that will be his next target - Andreas Sschutz, trainer.

quotes.race: Emirates Poule d'Essai des Poulains (Group 1) (3yo Colts) (Grande Course) (Turf)
quotes.quote: I expected Marhaba Ya Sanafi to run in the first five but I wasn't expecting him to win. The horse really improved from his last run, he did have a hard preparation going into his first few races. He had to settle for fourth early on in the race and he was off the bridle. We got daylight in the straight and he had some gas left in the tank. Mickael knows the horse inside out and everything went to plan - Andreas Schutz, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Prix du Haras de Fresnay-le-Buffard Jacques le Marois (Group 1) (3yo+ No Geldings) (Straight Course)
quotes.quote: I thought Quddwah ran super, obviously lacking experience going into a championship race. The ground was a little bit quick for him and I think his career is all ahead of him. I think it was a very solid run and we'll look forward to seeing him on his next start. We'll talk to [owner] Sheikh Ahmed and see what he wants to do, but an obvious next race would be the Leopardstown Mile - Simon Crisford, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: Bet With Ascot Donation Scheme Paradise Stakes (A Queen Anne Stakes Trial) (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Quddwah won at Newmarket nicely and we were due to run him at the July meeting in a Listed race, but just before he got a little issue and we had to put him away. However, he'd always shown he was a horse on the up. We'll have to see what Sheikh Ahmed [Al Maktoum, owner] wants to do but the Diomed is probably the next step up. He's a bit immature and Epsom might be a lot, but we have to look at what the options are and he just wants bringing along in a nice manner. He is in the Queen Anne and I don't think I'd have reservations about that, because he'll come on a lot from this and it just depends on what happens in the next few weeks. This is only his third race, so he's still got his whole future ahead of him. He's a very nice horse to have in the stable. He picked up well and finished off nicely, showing a lovely turn of foot. I think today's small field with this ground was the perfect start of him - Ed Crisford, joint-trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen Your Odds Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Quddwah had to be quite brave as the second took us off a line a bit but he showed a real likeable attitude. I'd never sat on him, but he's got a good pedigree and will go further - he's got a lovely relaxed character and should improve for further. The ground is on the dead side of good, it's not bad, and rode quite nice on him. The third horse gives some substance to the form and I'd say the race will work out. He's got a bit of quality - James Doyle, jockey.

runners.name: Quasar
runners.breeder: Ecurie Des Monceaux, Lordship Stud Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Infinity Nine Horses & Qatar Racing Limited

quotes.race: Jersey Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Haatem is a pleasure to have around and I would love to think we will have an association for a few years to come. He deserved his day in the sun and hopefully there will be many more. He was very unlucky in the Woodcote and it was probably my fault because I kept running him over six furlongs. Both Jamie Spencer and James Doyle both said he won't have a problem going to seven furlongs and they were right, again! He carried a 3lb penalty today, he got to the front very easy and I'm just delighted for the horse. It's a Group 3 but I think this Jersey was an awful lot more than it normally is. He has credit for a lot more than that I'm sure a Group 1 is coming very soon - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Craven Stakes (Group 3) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Haatem is a good horse and always has been. He won a Vintage Stakes with a subsequent Champagne Stakes winner behind him and was fifth in a Dewhurst last year. I said to Sean that I thought he'd get the trip very well and it seems to be this week that horses that race handy are winning. I don't think you can say that was an average performance. He looked pretty good there. He has done it on the racecourse and 25-1 seems to be a little bit generous for the Guineas. He and Rosallion do a lot of work together, Rosallion is a horse with an awful lot of speed whereas this horse gets a trip extremely well. Rosallion will get the mile and they both will probably run. We've made no secret about how special we think Rosallion is and this horse surprised me with the manner of his win today. It is nice to have two very good milers on our hands with two very good chances. I think one has an exceptional chance and one now has a better chance than he had before - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Nicholson Gin Vintage Stakes (Group 2) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Haatem is a lovely horse and he deserved that after running so well in the Coventry and the Superlative. He was very unlucky in the Woodcote. I thought this was his day and could be his Derby, but he will get better as the year goes on and he is a horse big enough for next year. He's not about being a two-year-old, he ran here first time and he has improved all year. He is a Group 2 winner now, so obviously we will have to look at Group 1s, but he is getting better - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Superlative Stakes (Group 2)
quotes.quote: I'm delighted with that, we've always thought a lot of Haatem and he's got a bright future. Next year will probably be his year, he's in a few nice races towards the end of the year, he'll probably be better on a sound surface. He takes his racing very well and physically he's a very nice horse. The winner looks a very good one - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A dual Group 3 winner last year, placed in two Guineas, he's come back looking fantastic. He'll start off in the Group 2 at Sandown this week but his main target is the Queen Anne. 22-04-25

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late H H Aga Khan

runners.name: Zekret
runners.breeder: S.C.E.A Des Prairies, Ecurie Castillon Bloodstock & Ecurie D

runners.name: Zarakchic
runners.owner: J-C Seroul, G Augustin-Normand & Guy Pariente Holding

runners.name: Rafale Design
runners.owner: Laurent Dassault, Cormac Farrell Et Al

runners.name: Maupassant
runners.breeder: Suc Y Seydoux De Clausonne & Mme L Louis
runners.owner: Mme Laetitia Louis & Le Marais Sas
